34230.title: SAP Fiori Consultant
34230.description:
Our Ottawa based, public sector client is seeking an experienced SAP Fiori Consultant to implement, customize, and optimize SAP Fiori solutions while providing SOP creation, training, and knowledge transfer. The successful candidate will work closely with business stakeholders to streamline processes, enhance worker productivity, and ensure seamless integration with existing SAP systems. 
Work Model: 100% Onsite –Ottawa, ON
Hours: Monday to Friday, 7.5 hours/day

Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct detailed analysis of existing data systems and business processes

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and identify process optimization opportunities

  • Develop SOPs, training documentation, and conduct training sessions/workshops

  • Implement SAP Fiori enhancements, ensuring best practices and industry standards are applied

  • Create process flow maps for current and future states with SMEs

  • Monitor system performance metrics and provide optimization recommendations

  • Translate business requirements into technical specifications and project documentation

  • Contribute to project planning, WBS creation, resource allocation, and risk management

Required Skills & Experience

  • 5+ years experience with each of the following:

  • SAP Fiori, SAPUI5, Gateway, OData services, ABAP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SAP HANA, Power BI

  • Proven experience creating SOPs and delivering end-user training

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and stakeholder communication skills

  • Experience in business analysis, project management, and process improvement initiatives

    Education & Certifications

  • 4-year university degree in Computer Science, Programming, or equivalent

  • SAP Certified Development Associate – SAP Fiori Application Developer (or equivalent)

  • Accreditation in Business Transformation considered an asset

32647.title: Senior Manager, Radio System Engineering
32647.description:
As the Senior Manager of Radio System Engineering, you will lead all technical aspects of radio system architecture, including air interface definition, concept of operations, functional specifications, and physical implementation of RF functions. You will define the functional and performance requirements for the radio system across the satellite payload, user terminals, and ground infrastructure.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Provide expert-level leadership in RF system development, including trade-offs involving ACP, PAR, out-of-band emissions, pass-band ripple, group delay, and more.

  • Support the finalization of radio system implementation involving agile multi-beam phased array antennas and beam hopping technology.

  • Define operational concepts for all phases of the system lifecycle such as user terminal commissioning, network entry, satellite handovers, time synchronization, and adaptive coding and modulation (ACM).

  • Act as the principal architect for defining air interfaces between user terminals, ground infrastructure, and satellite payloads.

  • Collaborate with RF, antenna, system, and terminal engineers to partition functionality between hardware and software components.

  • Provide input to the system modeling team on design assumptions and strategies for modeling link performance, accounting for impairments across system components.

  • Work closely with the Verification and Test team to ensure thorough validation of requirements and system performance.

  • Participate in relevant industry standards forums (e.g., DVB) and provide strategic recommendations to align internal systems with evolving standards.

Education & Experience – Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Computer, or Systems Engineering.

  • 15+ years of experience in RF communications systems and/or RF equipment development.

  • Demonstrated experience taking RF systems from concept through iterative design, specification development, and low-rate production.

  • Strong background in system architecture, requirements management, and performance assessment for communication systems.

Education & Experience – Assets:

  • Familiarity with DVB standards such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2.

  • Solid understanding of digital communications, spread spectrum techniques, single and multi-carrier modulation (e.g., PSK, APSK, QAM).

  • Proficiency in MATLAB or equivalent tools for modeling and analyzing RF communication systems.

  • Deep knowledge of RF passive and active components and microwave frequency performance, including the effects of environmental factors such as rain fade.

  • Strong foundation in RF transceiver architecture and digital communication theory.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively engage stakeholders across engineering, management, and external partners.

  • Collaborative, adaptable, and capable of leading multidisciplinary teams in high-performance environments.

32648.title: RF Systems Engineer
32648.description:
As an RF Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for simulating and modeling terrestrial and in-orbit communication systems. You will play a key role in supporting the definition of system architecture and ensuring high-performance, reliable RF communication across all network components.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Simulate and model end-to-end communication systems, incorporating both ground and space segments.

  • Collaborate with system architects, RF engineers, antenna specialists, and terminal/station teams to allocate system functions across hardware and software domains.

  • Analyze RF link performance, manage link budgets, and account for impairments introduced by various system components.

  • Develop and maintain system performance budgets and derive detailed specifications for RF links, RF subsystems, and antenna systems.

  • Characterize overall system performance through simulations and trade studies.

  • Provide technical input to regulatory, coordination, and market access teams to support licensing and compliance efforts.

Education & Experience – Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, with emphasis in RF/microwave circuits or communication theory.

  • A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in RF communication systems.

  • Strong understanding of digital communication systems, spread spectrum, single and multi-carrier techniques, and modulation schemes such as PSK, APSK, and QAM.

  • Familiarity with modulation standards such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2, as well as Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) techniques.

  • Proficient in MATLAB or equivalent tools for modeling and analysis of RF communication systems.

Specialized Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Demonstrated experience in analysis and simulation of communication systems.

  • In-depth knowledge of RF passive and active components.

  • Good understanding of advanced antenna technologies, including digital beamforming and fast beam hopping.

  • Experience characterizing radio performance at microwave frequencies, including the effects of rain fade and atmospheric interference.

  • Solid understanding of RF transceiver architectures and digital communication theory.
32648.publicDescription:
As a RF Systems Engineer, you’ll be responsible for simulating and modeling the terrestrial and in-orbit communication systems for Lightspeed and support the definition of the architecture.

Main Responsibilities

  • Simulate and model communication systems
  • Work with system architects, RF engineers, antenna engineers, User Terminal and Landing Station engineers, to partition functions between hardware and software domains
  • Model RF link performance and manage link budgets accounting for impairments through the different elements in the system
  • Derive specifications for RF links and RF and antenna subsystems
  • Characterize and analyze system performance. Develop and maintain performance budgets
  • Provide technical support to regulatory, coordination, and market access teams 

Education & Experience Required

  • Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering with emphasis in RF/microwave circuits or communication theory
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience RF communication systems
  • Knowledge of digital communication systems, spread spectrum, single and multi-carrier techniques, modulation types such as PSK, APSK, QAM
  • Specific experience with modulation standard such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2, as well as with Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) methods
  • Good experience in MATLAB or other tools for modeling and analyzing RF communication systems

Specialized Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Experience performing analysis and simulation of communication systems
  • Thorough understanding of RF passive and active components
  • Good understanding of active antenna beam forming technologies including digital beam forming, and fast beam hopping
  • Experience characterizing radio performance at microwave frequencies, including rain fade and its effects on the communication links
  • Knowledge of RF transceiver architectures and digital communication theor

34223.title: IT Technical Analyst – Data Governance & Microsoft Purview
34223.description:
Required Experience:

  • 3–5 years of experience as an IT Technical Analyst

  • 1–3 years of hands-on experience with Microsoft 365

  • 1–3 years of experience working with Microsoft Purview

Core Competencies:

  • Technical Proficiency:
    In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Purview, Microsoft 365 workloads, and Azure capabilities, with a strong foundation in cloud-based data governance solutions.

  • Data Governance & Security:
    Solid understanding of data governance frameworks, data lifecycle management, and security best practices to ensure organizational compliance and data integrity.

  • Compliance Expertise:
    Familiarity with data protection regulations and compliance standards such as GDPR, HIPAA, and other regional or industry-specific frameworks.

  • Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills:
    Strong analytical mindset and troubleshooting abilities to address complex governance and data classification challenges.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration:
    Demonstrated ability to work effectively with diverse teams including data architects, business analysts, and cybersecurity professionals.

  • Automation & Scripting:
    Proficiency with scripting tools such as PowerShell for automating workflows and integrating Purview capabilities across systems.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with Exact Data Match (EDM) for advanced data classification and protection.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Policy Development & Enforcement:
    Design, implement, and maintain data policies including Data Loss Prevention (DLP), data retention, and sensitive information protection measures.

  • Data Cataloging & Lineage:
    Build and manage a centralized data catalog, define metadata standards, and establish data lineage to promote transparency and data discoverability.

  • Risk & Compliance Monitoring:
    Conduct risk assessments, proactively monitor for compliance violations, and implement remediation strategies leveraging Purview’s capabilities.

  • System Integration:
    Seamlessly integrate Microsoft Purview with Microsoft 365 workloads and other enterprise data sources to enhance governance coverage.

  • Reporting & Insights:
    Generate actionable insights through reports on data usage, compliance status, and governance gaps to support continuous improvement.

34250.title: SAP CM/OCM Consultant (S/4HANA)
34250.description:
Our Vancouver based clinet is looking for an experienced SAP Change/Organizational Change Management (CM/OCM) Consultant to support a fast-moving SAP S/4HANA transformation. This is an urgent backfill. You will lead change strategy and execution across stakeholder engagement, communications, training, and adoption—partnering closely with program leadership and functional workstreams.  HYBRID ON SITE VANCOUVER

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the change management strategy and integrated plan for an S/4HANA program.

  • Drive stakeholder analysis, change impact assessments, and readiness activities.

  • Build and run the communications plan (executive and end-user messaging, artifacts).

  • Define and execute the training strategy (curriculum, delivery approach, enablement).

  • Establish adoption KPIs/OKRs, track readiness, and report progress to leadership/PMO.

  • Stand up and manage the change agent/super-user network; support cutover & hypercare.

  • Coordinate with PMO, SAP functional leads, and business sponsors to align scope, timeline, and risks.

  • Be on-site in Vancouver weekly to facilitate workshops and key change activities.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience leading enterprise ERP change/transformation programs, with hands-on SAP S/4HANA exposure.

  • Strong delivery across impact assessments, comms, training, adoption, and readiness.

  • Excellent facilitation, executive communication, and stakeholder management skills.

  • Prosci/ADKAR or equivalent methodology experience (asset).

  • Mining industry experience is an asset.

  • Able to travel to Vancouver weekly; work primarily remote otherwise.

  • Eligible to work in Canada.

34101.title: Sr. Drupal Developer
34101.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Drupal Developer with deep experience in PHP and Drupal to lead and support the development of robust, scalable web solutions. The ideal candidate has a strong command of both front-end and back-end development, is comfortable working with a variety of contrib modules and custom code, and thrives in a collaborative, DevOps-driven environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of Drupal-based websites and applications.

  • Build and customize content types, views, and display logic using modules such as Display Suite and Webforms.

  • Develop custom modules and maintain high standards for coding practices, testing, and documentation.

  • Optimize site performance through Search API integrations with ElasticSearch.

  • Lead or support complex Drupal migrations using the Drupal Migrate module.

  • Apply and create patches to core and contrib modules as necessary.

  • Integrate and develop web services (RESTful APIs) and support external integrations.

  • Collaborate with front-end developers using JavaScript and CSS/Sass to create seamless user experiences.

  • Utilize container-based development environments using Docker DDEV or work in VirtualBox-based systems (e.g., AlmaLinux).

  • Manage source control, branching, and CI/CD pipelines using Git and GitHub Actions.

  • Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and DevOps discussions.

Required Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience with Drupal (7/8/9/10) and PHP development.

  • Expertise in a wide variety of contrib modules and custom module development.

  • Deep understanding of Drupal theming, content type customization, and site-building best practices.

  • Strong experience with Search API, ElasticSearch, and performance tuning.

  • Demonstrated knowledge of web services integration and Drupal migration workflows.

  • Competency with front-end technologies including JavaScript, CSS/Sass.

  • Proficiency with Docker DDEV or VirtualBox-based Linux environments (especially AlmaLinux).

  • Comfortable with Git, GitHub, and CI/CD pipelines.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience integrating with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM.

  • Familiarity with Azure Cloud environments.

  • Knowledge of C# and .NET development.

Personal Attributes:

  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

  • Excellent communication and time management.

  • Familiarity with multiple Dynamics modules and how they interact

  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills

32517.title: Cloud Production Application Support Analyst
32517.description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:
We are seeking a Cloud Support Analyst (Level II) to join a growing technology operations team. Reporting into a senior leadership role within the cloud support function, this individual will work directly with internal users and stakeholders to resolve issues related to enterprise systems and data. The role also involves identifying opportunities to enhance system functionality and streamline operational processes. This position requires regular engagement with third-party vendors on implementations, enhancements, and complex troubleshooting initiatives.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Apply process and workflow methodologies to enhance support outcomes

  • Demonstrate strong business acumen and understanding of organizational systems

  • Collaborate effectively within both immediate and cross-functional teams

  • Manage assigned tasks and engagements with minimal supervision

  • Build credibility quickly through professional presence and subject-matter expertise

  • Operate effectively in an office-based setting

  • Navigate high-demand environments with fast turnarounds

  • Provide occasional support across global time zones

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Post-secondary education in IT, computer science, or a related field

  • Proven experience supporting enterprise-grade cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP)

  • Strong SQL skills used in root cause analysis and issue resolution

  • Experience working with databases and scripting for support-related automation

  • Certifications in one or more cloud technologies

  • Familiarity with at least one programming language (e.g., Java)

  • Exposure to automation tools or scripting repeatable support tasks

34146.title: IT Business Analyst
34146.description:
Title: IT Business Analyst
Required Experience:
  • [Location]: candidates must be local to North York ON M2R 3T4 and able to commute onsite 5 days a week.
  • [Degree requirement]: Must have a university degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience (associate’s degree and 4 years’ experience no post-secondary degree and 6 years’ experience). (DO NOT INFER)
  • [Certification Requirement]: Must have WHMIS certification. (DO NOT INFER)
  • [Experience Requirement]: Must have 2-8 years of experience supporting on-site manufacturing IT systems (manufacturing execution system, data historian system, interfaces for integrated lab equipment, and related physical hardware/workstations, printers, scanners, WiFi bridges, ThinClient devices) with technical troubleshooting from inception to resolution
  • [Experience Requirement]: Must have 2-8 years of experience collaborating across different Manufacturing departments, such as Digital, Operations, Automation, and Quality to provide systems and process improvement to manufacturing IT systems (manufacturing execution system, data historian system, interfaces for integrated lab equipment, and related physical hardware/workstations).
  • [Experience Requirement]: Must have good understanding of IT Software Development Life Cycle (SLDC) and Project Management Methodologies
Preferred Experience:
  • [Experience Preferred]: Knowledge and awareness of regulatory standards requirements from FDA and Health Canada particularly GXP, 21 CFR Part 11, Electronic Records and Electronic Signatures, Data Integrity Requirements and ALCOA applied to IT Systems would be an asset.
  • [Experience Preferred]: Experience with computer systems validation in pharmaceutical industry.
  • [Experience Preferred]: Must have experience drafting and maintaining documentation in alignment with GxP and required by deviations / change controls, including but not limited to architecture specifications, installation procedures, and detailed specification documents.
34146.publicDescription:
IT Business Analyst

We are seeking a highly motivated and self-driven individual to work in a complex and thriving global IT environment in support of the Toronto site, one of the largest vaccine research and development and manufacturing sites in the world. This role will report to the Digital Shop Floor Tools Lead and will be supporting all on-site manufacturing IT systems.

 

Location: North York ON (onsite 5 days a week)

Type: Contract

Duration: 12 months, long term contract renews every 1 year

Pay: $40 to $48 per hour CAD; $30-40 USD

 

Skills Required: The candidates must possess the following skills and this experience must be displayed on their resume: These are essential for seamless collaboration across different departments encompassing diverse skillsets and expertise, such as Digital, Operations, Automation, and Quality.  

  • Must have WHMIS certification.
  • Must have a university degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Must have 2-6 years of providing in-person support of physical shop floor hardware/workstations (e.g. printers, scanners, WiFi bridges, ThinClient devices, peripherals) in a manufacturing environment. These systems include the manufacturing execution system, data historian system, interfaces for integrated lab equipment, and related physical hardware/workstations.
  • Must have 2-6 years Business Analyst and support experience with computerized systems such as manufacturing execution systems, data historian systems, automation and control systems.
  • Good understanding of IT Software Development Life Cycle (SLDC) and Project Management Methodologies.
  • Must be able to supply their own PPE. Requires CSA certified steel toe boots. If there is a need to enter a live construction area (as we have projects where the facilities are being renovated) there are additional PPE requirements such as safety helmet, safety glasses, and gloves.
  • The candidate for this role is expected to enter our manufacturing areas from time to time to provide on-the-floor support. As they will be entering live areas they may be exposed to Pertussis, Diphtheria, Tetanus and Flu. They will need to be vaccinated for these to enter those areas.

 

Skills Preferred:

  • Knowledge and awareness of regulatory standards requirements from FDA and Health Canada particularly GXP, 21 CFR Part 11, Electronic Records and Electronic Signatures, Data Integrity Requirements and ALCOA applied to IT Systems would be an asset.
  • Experience with computer systems validation in pharmaceutical industry.
  • Ability to manage relationships with external vendors.

 

As an IT Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting on-site manufacturing IT systems from technical troubleshooting perspective as well as systems and process improvement perspective.

  • Natural curiosity and passion for technology, ability to quickly learn manufacturing processes, and strong organizational and time-management skills. 
  • Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities, effective communication skills (technical writing, verbal, and presentation)
  • Self-driven with a passion for taking ownership for their work with the ability to prioritize and execute tasks from initiation to closure and a proven track record of successful independent work and self-sufficiency. 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Take ownership of manufacturing IT system issues from inception to resolution, collaborating closely with users and support teams to troubleshoot and resolve.
  • Escalate and coordinate with local infrastructure team, global support teams and vendor if required to provide timely support and resolution to various system issues.
  • Draft and maintain documentation in alignment with GxP and company processes as required by deviations / change controls, including but not limited to architecture specifications, installation procedures, and detailed specification documents.
  • Provide in-person support of physical shop floor hardware/workstations (e.g. printers, scanners, WiFi bridges, ThinClient devices, peripherals).
  • Participate in on-call support for addressing system emergencies outside of regular business hours.
  • Drive system and process improvements to improve user experience and/or reduce required support and troubleshooting effort.

 

Location/Scope:

  • The job site is in Toronto, ON, Canada. Consistent on-site presence is mandatory for this role to facilitate troubleshooting and relationship management.
  • This role may occasionally require after-hours support availability to address system emergencies as the manufacturing facilities operate on a 24/7 basis. Overtime hours must be agreed with management.
  • Due to the nature of the job (production floor support) up to date vaccination and WHMIS certification is required.

32607.title: Product Line Manager - CIP
32607.description:
The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is currently seeking an experienced Optical Networking resource who would be interested in working within the CIP vertical. 

We are looking for a candidate who is currently based in Canada since this is offered on a remote full-time permanent basis and requires the resource to be located within the country.

The candidate in this role should have the following requirements:

  • Highly experienced in CIP Optical Networking Deployment
  • Over 8 Years of Optical Networking expertise
  • Experience with Optical Network deployment and system development
  • Experience with Optical PLM
  • Experience with Operational Support Systems
  • Experience with Open Standards and Concepts

34239.title: Senior Project Manager (IT Risk Obsolescence and Cost Optimization)
34239.description:
Experience migrating Data Centers from On-Premise to Cloud (AWS) required.


Qualifications & Background
  • At least 5 years of progressive experience delivering IT-focused initiatives from initial planning through to completion, with a strong emphasis on client outcomes.
  • Minimum 3 years overseeing large-scale or complex technology programs.
  • Demonstrated success in driving projects within Agile frameworks, with familiarity in both SDLC and PDLC principles.
  • Solid grasp of multiple project delivery approaches, including Agile, Scrum, and Waterfall.
  • Skilled at managing competing priorities and deadlines across multiple work streams.
  • Adept at leading diverse, cross-functional teams toward shared objectives.
  • Background in budgeting, resource planning, and mitigating delivery risks within IT environments.
  • Experience working in structured or unionized settings considered an asset.
  • Strategic mindset with the ability to align technology solutions to business outcomes and financial goals.
  • Track record of introducing creative, efficiency-focused strategies and gaining stakeholder alignment.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication abilities to engage effectively at all levels of the organization.
  • Capable of building and maintaining productive relationships across technical, operational, and business teams.
  • Comfortable with project management and collaboration platforms.
  • Exposure to managing distributed Agile teams is a plus.
  • Familiarity with scaled Agile delivery practices is an advantage.

32575.title: Software Developer, Sr. (.Net, Javascript)
32575.description:
*Based in Canada

*Fully Remote (once per year travel within North America for team event)


Role Overview

We’re seeking a skilled software developer with strong experience in .NET to join a collaborative, distributed team. This position offers the chance to contribute to impactful projects, leverage modern cloud technologies, and work with a range of tools and frameworks in a supportive, growth-oriented environment.

Key Expectations

  • Apply solid software engineering principles and a strong understanding of core programming concepts.

  • Produce clean, efficient, and well-structured code in C#, JavaScript, and related technologies, following established standards and best practices.

  • Learn and adapt to evolving tools and platforms, including cloud services (e.g., Azure), SQL databases, containerization solutions, and front-end frameworks such as Angular.

  • Engage effectively in team discussions (English-speaking environment), providing and receiving constructive feedback.

  • Show initiative in problem-solving while knowing when to seek guidance.

  • Deliver quality work on time while maintaining attention to detail.

Core Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and test software solutions using .NET and related technologies.

  • Participate in code reviews, offering feedback on application logic, database queries, and UI components.

  • Diagnose and resolve issues spanning back-end services, databases, and front-end frameworks.

  • Contribute to technical documentation, including APIs, schemas, and system workflows.

  • Assist in more complex initiatives, such as cloud-based deployments using container technologies.

  • Stay current with development practices and tools, including CI/CD pipelines and containerization platforms.

  • Adhere to established workflows for source control (Git) and deployment processes.

34238.title: Microsoft AI & Automation Specialist
34238.description:
We’re seeking a skilled Microsoft AI & Automation Specialist to support a major AI and digital services initiative. This role will focus on leveraging Microsoft Fabric, Power Platform, AI Foundry, and Copilot platforms, developing AI solutions, and integrating large language models (LLMs) with enterprise systems.

Must be eligible for Reliability Status Security Clearance (Canadian residency for past 5 years)

Responsibilities:

  • Provide expert-level guidance on Microsoft Fabric, Power Platform, AI Foundry, and Copilot

  • Develop architectural plans and patterns to advance the AI strategy

  • Support Azure and AI deliverables, collaborating with technical SMEs

  • Build solutions in Python and integrate with LLMs and platforms such as SharePoint, Databricks, ServiceNow, and SAP

  • Design and implement integrations with external systems

  • Create technical documentation and user guides

  • Contribute as an AI engineer across the full model lifecycle (training, evaluation, deployment, integration, testing)

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • Degree or diploma in Computer Science or equivalent experience with AI focus

  • 5+ years recent experience with Azure technologies

  • 5+ years recent Python development experience

  • 1+ year recent experience with LLMs and platforms such as SharePoint, Databricks, ServiceNow, SAP, Power Platform, MS Fabric

  • Proven experience designing, building, and deploying AI deliverables

  • Strong knowledge of model deployment and integration practices

  • Demonstrated experience in technical documentation and user guide creation

Nice-to-Have:

  • Experience with PostgreSQL

34237.title: Business Systems Analyst – Payments Modernization
34237.description:
We are seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst to join a large-scale Payments Modernization initiative. The successful candidate will work within an Agile Scrum team to gather, document, and manage business requirements, translate them into actionable specifications, support testing efforts, and contribute to continuous improvement of processes and systems.
SECRET CLEARANCE - Mandatory

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate within a Scrum team to convert business requirements into detailed specifications and user stories.

  • Facilitate refinement sessions and ensure development teams fully understand requirements.

  • Write, plan, and execute test scenarios; coordinate and support user acceptance testing.

  • Maintain process, procedure, and training documentation.

  • Analyze and validate solutions for complex business problems.

  • Identify and recommend improvements to business processes and system capabilities.

  • Participate in the Business Analysis Community of Practice to share knowledge and best practices.

  • Provide subject-matter expertise and guidance on relevant projects.

Required Skills & Experience

  • University degree or college diploma in business administration, commerce, computer science, or a related field.

  • Minimum 5 years experience developing business requirements and delivering business systems analysis for large IT-enabled projects.

  • Minimum 3 years experience in an Agile environment as a business analyst.

  • Strong facilitation skills for meetings and workshops.

  • Demonstrated adaptability to change and ability to work with diverse stakeholders while managing multiple priorities.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of high-availability banking and payment systems.

  • Professional certifications such as CBAP or CCBA.

34234.title: Director of Information Technology (IT)  – Cloud Technology & Infrastructure
34234.description:
We are looking for a forward-thinking IT leader to guide our technology operations and spearhead the strategic growth of our cloud-first environment. This role will oversee the planning, delivery, and continual improvement of enterprise IT services, with a strong focus on cloud platforms, SaaS applications, and modern infrastructure solutions. You’ll have the opportunity to shape technology direction in a dynamic, expanding organization while staying hands-on with critical initiatives.
The successful candidate will combine leadership, technical expertise, and business alignment to ensure our technology landscape remains secure, scalable, and optimized for performance. This is both a strategic and execution-focused position, requiring a proven ability to deliver results in a high-growth setting.

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead, mentor, and inspire the IT team to foster innovation, accountability, and collaboration.
  • Manage and optimize cloud platforms and applications, including Microsoft 365, AWS, and Azure, ensuring alignment with organizational priorities.
  • Oversee the delivery of IT projects such as infrastructure upgrades, security enhancements, and modernization programs.
  • Maintain the security, availability, and scalability of network and cloud environments through best practices and proactive risk management.
  • Drive process improvements through automation, integration, and innovative technology solutions.
  • Establish and enforce IT policies, compliance measures, and security standards to protect organizational data and systems.
  • Partner with senior leadership to define and execute a technology roadmap that supports business growth.
  • Provide hands-on support for high-priority issues and initiatives to minimize operational disruptions.
  • Stay ahead of emerging technologies and industry developments to maintain a competitive edge.

Qualifications
  • 7+ years of progressive IT experience, including at least 3 years in a leadership role.
  • Deep knowledge of cloud services, infrastructure, and enterprise technology ecosystems.
  • Strong technical foundation in networking, security, and systems administration.
  • Demonstrated success in delivering complex IT projects in evolving or scaling organizations.
  • Solid understanding of cybersecurity, compliance frameworks, and risk management practices.
  • Proven leadership and communication skills with the ability to inspire and manage high-performing teams.
  • Strategic mindset with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to align IT initiatives to business outcomes.
  • Experience identifying cost efficiencies, automation opportunities, and process improvements in cloud environments.

34233.title: Business Development Leader (Google)
34233.description:
We are seeking an accomplished and results-driven sales leader to accelerate growth within our technology business. This pivotal role will focus on uncovering and winning new business opportunities, while deepening our engagement and influence within the Google technology space. You will be instrumental in shaping and executing our go-to-market approach, collaborating with internal teams across sales, delivery, and partnerships to bring impactful solutions to clients.

Leveraging your deep knowledge of Google’s offerings and your ability to sell complex, solution-based services, you will establish credibility quickly, identify value-creation opportunities, and harness our organization’s full technology capabilities to address our clients’ most critical needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Proactively identify, pursue, and develop new client relationships in targeted accounts.

  • Partner with cross-functional teams to lead pursuit strategies and sales initiatives.

  • Build strong, trust-based relationships with decision-makers and influencers at prospective and existing clients.

  • Establish and maintain collaborative relationships with key contacts within Google, ensuring alignment and joint growth opportunities.

  • Support the development and execution of a targeted Google partnership strategy aligned to business goals.

  • Work with clients to understand business challenges and design tailored, high-impact solutions using the organization’s complete service portfolio.

  • Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to design and deliver effective go-to-market programs.

  • Represent the company at industry events, partner functions, and strategic meetings to showcase capabilities and identify new opportunities.

Success Indicators

  • Demonstrates integrity, collaboration, and professionalism in every client and partner interaction.

  • Develops a strong understanding of client industries, priorities, and challenges, earning recognition as a trusted advisor.

  • Engages curiosity and strategic thinking to diagnose client needs and deliver actionable solutions.

  • Promotes a collaborative and inclusive environment that inspires top performance.

  • Adopts and champions digital tools, data-driven selling, and innovative business practices.

  • Continues to expand market and technical expertise through ongoing learning.

Qualifications

  • Proven track record of building trust and credibility with stakeholders at all levels within client and partner organizations.

  • Demonstrated success in generating new business, leading strategic pursuits, and closing complex deals.

  • Strong background and hands-on experience in the Google ecosystem, including knowledge of product capabilities and partner programs.

  • 10+ years of progressive sales or business development experience within mid-market and enterprise environments.

  • Documented success selling professional services, cloud-based solutions, or digital transformation initiatives.

  • Highly results-oriented with a proactive, solution-focused approach to business challenges.

  • Experience selling across multiple industries in the Canadian market is an asset.

  • Post-secondary education or equivalent professional experience.

  • Team-oriented mindset with an appreciation for individual contributions to collective success.

34085.title: Full-Stack Developer
34085.description:
We are seeking a Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Angular, Java/Spring Boot, and cloud-native development to join a purpose-driven organization. In this role, you’ll contribute to the design, development, and deployment of secure, scalable, and resilient web applications and backend services used across Canada.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Develop, test, and maintain modern web applications using the Angular framework.
  • Design and implement RESTful services using Java and Spring Boot.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including DevOps, QA, and business stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions aligned with organizational goals.
  • Build and deploy applications to cloud environments using Azure AKS, OpenShift, or Kubernetes.
  • Create and manage Helm charts for Kubernetes-based deployments.
  • Work with relational databases such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server to support application data needs.
  • Ensure code quality and maintainability through automated testing, peer reviews, and adherence to development best practices.
  • Contribute to architectural decisions and provide technical guidance on cloud-native strategies and DevOps integration.
Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of experience as a Full Stack Developer or Software Engineer.
  • Proficiency with Angular (v10+), TypeScript, and front-end best practices.
  • Strong backend development experience with Java, Spring Boot, and RESTful API design.
  • Hands-on experience with container orchestration platforms such as Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), OpenShift, or vanilla Kubernetes.
  • Experience deploying applications using Helm and working in CI/CD environments.
  • Solid understanding of relational databases (e.g., Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQL Server) and writing performant SQL queries.
  • Familiarity with security, compliance, and performance requirements in regulated or healthcare environments is a strong asset.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to thrive in a collaborative, mission-focused team environment.

34227.title: Network Verification & Test Engineer
34227.description:
We are seeking a Network Verification & Test Engineer to validate the performance, reliability, and compliance of advanced networking systems. This role involves creating verification plans, executing system-level tests, automating configurations, and working with industry-standard traffic generation tools. The ideal candidate will bring a strong networking background, hands-on testing expertise, and the ability to work both independently and in collaborative team settings.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop system and subsystem verification matrices to ensure full coverage of all system requirements.

  • Coordinate and participate in system-level testing activities, including planning, execution, and reporting of results.

  • Design, develop, and maintain test cases and test beds to support various testing scenarios.

  • Execute tests using traffic generators (e.g., Spirent, IXIA, Test Center), packet capture tools (tcpdump), and performance tools (iPerf).

  • Validate networking features and performance across OSI layers, including TCP, UDP, IP networking, routing protocols, and network optimization techniques.

  • Implement and manage NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI for automated network device configuration.

  • Work with structured data formats such as JSON, JSON IETF, XML, YAML, PROTO, and REST APIs to support automation workflows.

  • Utilize Kubernetes (POD) and Docker containers for test environment setup and management.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance and functional issues, ensuring timely defect identification and resolution.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience with traffic generation and analysis tools such as Spirent, IXIA, Test Center, tcpdump, and iPerf.

  • Strong understanding of networking fundamentals, including OSI layers, TCP/UDP/IP protocols, routing protocols, and optimization methods.

  • Experience configuring and automating network devices using NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI.

  • Proficiency with structured data formats (JSON, XML, YAML, PROTO) and REST API integration.

  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker environments.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Python or Ansible for network automation and orchestration.

  • Prior experience in network verification, system integration testing, or telecom/network equipment validation.

  • Exposure to performance benchmarking and large-scale test environments.

34124.title: Project Managers – Real Property
34124.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking intermediate and senior-level Project Managers with experience in Real Property for upcoming federal government initiatives. 

Responsibilities:
Candidates must demonstrate experience in managing real property projects, which may include asset acquisitions, fit-ups, construction, renovations, or remediation of buildings, land, or infrastructure.

Tasks include:

  • Developing and gaining acceptance of project scope, budget, and schedule

  • Implementing communication plans with stakeholders

  • Coordinating multi-stakeholder engagement

  • Managing scope, budget, and schedule changes throughout the project lifecycle

  • Tracking and reporting with:

  • Time schedules

  • Work breakdown structures

  • Project scopes

  • Budget forecasts and cash flows

  • Status reports

Mandatory Requirements:

  • Intermediate Level: Minimum 3 years of real property project experience in the last 10 years

  • Senior Level: Minimum 5 years of real property project experience in the last 10 years

Additional Point-Rated Assets:

  • Experience preparing or leading the creation of:

  • Project Charter / Statement of Work

  • Project Management Plan

  • Risk Management Plans / Feasibility Studies

  • Project reporting, commissioning plans, and lessons learned

  • Experience managing:

  • Multi-disciplinary teams

  • Construction contracts

  • Cost and time control processes

  • Change management protocols

    Security Clearance:
    All candidates must hold an Enhanced Reliability clearance (or be eligible).

    Location Requirements:
    Preference for candidates in the Ottawa region. Work model (hybrid or on-site) is to be confirmed.

32266.title: Back-End Developer - Intermediate/Senior
32266.description:
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Thoroughly understand the requirements and design.
  • Collaborate with internal teams on various deliverables.
  • Understand High Level Design and prepare the Low-level design (the Integration / Interface modules) for the module assigned.
  • Code reviews and other project documents developed by juniors / peers.
  • Collaborate & work closely with Product teams, Project Managers, Architects, Software Engineers, Business Analysts & QA teams in different locations.
  • Review and report the status of development & proactively address issues/challenges which might impact the timelines.
  • Embed & enforce quality and standards with Development team.
  • Continually improve quality of delivery and capability by building and growing a high-performance team.
  • Review and report the deliverables to manager.
  • Contribute to company’s KB and Process improvements.
  • Adhere to company core standards & guidelines.
  • Assign accurate & detailed tasks regularly to the team.
  • Conduct model level effort estimation and integrate for complete application.
  • Performance Engineering, Tuning, and architecting scalable

MUST HAVE/REQUIREMENTS
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Minimum 6 years of work experience, along with equivalent lead experience.
  • Strong database and query building knowledge across multiple databases, with experience in PostgreSQL and Oracle.
  • Experience with Apache Kafka for building real-time, scalable data pipelines and handling event-driven communication within microservices architectures.
  • Knowledge on Application Servers like JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic.
  • Domain knowledge of banking and financial institutions and/or large enterprise IT environment will be a strong asset.
  • Proficient in core development tools such as Spring Boot, Eclipse, Maven, Sonar, JUnit, and Docker.
  • 5+ years of experience with enterprise software development.
  • Product implementation experience, with a focus on deploying and managing microservices using Spring Boot and Kafka.
  • Experience with enterprise software development in JAVA, J2EE, Spring (including Spring Boot), Hibernate, Web Services, MQ, REST-based APIs, Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka.
  • Strong experience in multi-threaded server-side Java programming, including Kafka producers and consumers to manage high-throughput messaging and event-driven systems.
  • Proven experience in the use of Eclipse, Maven, Sonar, and JUnit tools for development, testing, and continuous integration.
  • Experience working with agile methodologies, including continuous integration and deployment in Java-based microservices with Kafka as the backbone for event streaming.
  • Experience with Java development using JBuilder, Java, Servlets, EJB, J2EE, and frameworks like Spring, Hibernate, Struts, and Kafka for real-time event-driven architecture.
  • Proficiency in HTML, DHTML, JavaScript, XML, and CSS for building front-end interfaces, as well as integrating those with back-end Spring Boot APIs and Kafka for data synchronization.
  • Experience working with MS SQL, Oracle, DB2, OOAD, UML.
  • Ability to work in remote and/or office settings, with the flexibility to support offshore hours/time zones and adapt to client needs.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines, while maintaining focus on product quality and timely delivery.
  • Flexibility with working hours based on team and client needs, including support for distributed teams and different time zones.

NICE TO HAVE
  • Strong, clear, and concise written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and can foster team collaboration.
  • Out of the box thinking approach ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions 
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate to achieve positive outcomes 
  • Detail-oriented and strong ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
  • Aptitude to solve problems
  • Ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions in analysis at all levels of organization
  • Pro-active and has a strong desire to learn.

34222.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer
34222.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Experience Requirements:

  • Proven experience in high-speed analog IC design using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies

  • Strong understanding of transmission lines and other high-frequency passive components

  • Solid grasp of device physics and its influence on analog circuit performance, along with techniques to optimize performance

  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing, lab instrumentation, and evaluation of high-speed analog ICs

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

  • Excellent teamwork, verbal, and written communication skills

Education Requirements:

  • BS with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience

32638.title: DevOps Technical Analyst
32638.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking a self-motivated Technical Analyst to support a long-term engagement with our non for profit client. This is a two-year contract opportunity ideal for a DevOps-savvy analyst with a strong foundation in system analysis and cloud/infrastructure operations. The ideal candidate will thrive in a collaborative environment, have a passion for automation and modern DevOps practices, and be eager to take ownership in a hands-on technical role.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage, maintain, and enhance cloud and on-premise environments

  • Implement and optimize CI/CD pipelines

  • Conduct system and integration analysis to ensure high performance and availability

  • Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to support environment configuration and deployment

  • Leverage monitoring tools to identify and resolve technical issues proactively

  • Mentor junior team members and contribute to best practices documentation

Qualifications:

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field

  • Certifications such as AWS, ITIL, or similar are an asset

Experience:

  • 5+ years in system analysis, environment management, or software engineering

  • Experience with cloud platforms and managing hybrid infrastructure

  • Hands-on with DevOps tools and CI/CD processes

Technical Skills:

  • Proficient in APIs, RESTful services, and system integration

  • Skilled in containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)

  • Experience with version control tools (Git)

  • Scripting capabilities (Python, Bash)

  • Familiarity with monitoring and automation frameworks

Soft Skills:

  • Excellent analytical and communication skills

  • Leadership qualities and ability to mentor others

  • Self-starter mindset with strong organizational abilities

34134.title: Google Cloud Practice Leader – Delivery Consulting
34134.description:
Overview
We are looking for a strategic and hands-on leader to spearhead our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) practice. This senior-level role is designed for someone who thrives at the intersection of technical delivery, client consulting, and business growth. You’ll be instrumental in shaping and scaling a high-performing GCP services organization—overseeing delivery excellence, building innovative cloud offerings, and enabling client success across industries.

This is an ideal opportunity for a consulting-oriented leader who not only understands the GCP ecosystem but is also energized by building teams, solutions, and long-term client relationships.

RESPONSIBILITIES
 
  • Practice Leadership & Growth
  • Build, scale, and oversee the GCP services practice with accountability for delivery success, client satisfaction, and team development.
  • Guide strategic initiatives and collaborate with cross-functional leaders to align cloud offerings with business priorities.
  • Technical Leadership
  • Serve as a senior technical authority for GCP engagements—able to lead architecture discussions and solution reviews without needing to operate at a granular API level.
  • Drive high-level design and implementation strategies, working closely with technical teams and client stakeholders.
  • Client Engagement & Delivery Oversight
  • Act as a trusted advisor for enterprise customers, helping them realize the value of GCP technologies within their digital transformation journeys.
  • Ensure best-in-class delivery execution across projects—owning accountability for timelines, outcomes, and quality standards.
  • Business Development & Sales Enablement
  • Support pre-sales activities including opportunity shaping, proposals, solutioning, and go-to-market efforts.
  • Partner with internal teams and external clients to evangelize service offerings and identify new revenue opportunities.
  • Innovation & Enablement
  • Develop reusable delivery frameworks, methodologies, and assets to accelerate service delivery.
  • Represent the GCP practice in external forums and internal strategy discussions—helping raise visibility and influence roadmaps.
    EXPERIENCE
    • 10+ years of experience in IT consulting, cloud delivery, or professional services environments.
    • Strong technical foundation in GCP, with a proven ability to guide architectural conversations and lead multi-disciplinary delivery teams.
    • Background in services delivery, including experience designing and scaling cloud-based solutions for enterprise clients.
    • Experience in client-facing roles, with excellent communication and stakeholder engagement capabilities.
    • Demonstrated ability to contribute to sales cycles—providing solution input, influencing outcomes, and driving growth.
    • Proven success in building service offerings and bringing new solutions to market.
    • A leadership style that emphasizes accountability, ownership, and collaboration.
    • Familiarity with Google Cloud partnerships, certification paths, and ecosystem programs is an asset.
    • Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or equivalent experience.

34084.title: Cloud Site Reliability Engineer - Azure AWS
34084.description:
Cloud Site Reliability Engineer – AWS & Azure


Responsibilities
  • Oversee the design and improvement of infrastructure using SRE best practices, including IaC, recovery automation, and systems that detect and resolve issues independently.
  • Manage and fine-tune critical services across both cloud and on-prem environments: Kubernetes clusters, CI/CD pipelines, artifact registries, and custom workloads.
  • Enhance observability through intelligent logging, metrics, tracing, and alerting.  Ensuring systems are transparent and actionable in real time.
  • Champion automation by eliminating repetitive tasks, from deployment workflows to security audits, through scripting and tooling.
  • Elevate the developer experience for 80+ engineers and researchers by streamlining secure, reliable workflows across hybrid and cloud-native platforms.
  • Take ownership of IAM governance across platforms like Azure AD and AWS IAM. Implement lifecycle automation, auditing, and access controls.
  • Foster a culture of operational excellence with strong practices around security, incident management, and resilience engineering.
  • Act as a trusted partner to developers and researchers, enabling their speed and innovation without compromising stability.

Experience
  • Experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or Systems Engineering within fast-paced, technically demanding environments.
  • Strong background in Linux systems and cloud infrastructure, with hands-on experience in AWS (primary) and Azure environments.
  • Solid command of Kubernetes and container orchestration in production environments.
  • Expertise in Infrastructure as Code tools such as Ansible, building reproducible, scalable infrastructure is second nature to you.
  • Deep experience in observability and incident response: you know how to set up effective monitoring, handle incidents, and lead blameless post-mortems.
  • A security-first mindset, especially when it comes to protecting distributed systems and developer workflows.
  • Proven ability to support and optimize CI/CD pipelines, container image builds, and artifact lifecycle management.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.  You build trust across teams and advocate for thoughtful, scalable solutions.
  • Bonus if you’ve worked with event-driven architectures using technologies like Kafka.

32649.title: Ambulatory Clinical Informatics Analyst - Oracle Health Cerner
32649.description:
Our client is seeking an experienced Ambulatory Clinical Informatics Analyst to support the OPOR (One Person One Record) Program’s Ambulatory Portfolio. This role requires a strong background in Oracle Health (Cerner) and will involve collaboration with clinicians, project leadership, and Oracle Health consultants to design, configure, and translate clinical workflows.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Support ambulatory care design and configuration initiatives.

  • Facilitate strategy execution and knowledge translation to subject matter experts (SMEs).

  • Engage with clinicians to review and validate workflows.

  • Participate in organizational change management and co-facilitate design sessions.

  • Collaborate with Oracle Health consultants and internal project teams.

  • Identify risks/issues and contribute to resolution strategies.

  • Provide ongoing updates to OPOR project leadership.

Requirements:

  • Degree/diploma in a health-related discipline (or equivalent experience).

  • 5+ years of experience in a health-related field.

  • 2+ years in Clinical Informatics or supporting large-scale CIS implementations (Oracle Health/Cerner strongly preferred).

  • Deep understanding of ambulatory/medicine clinic workflows and interdisciplinary coordination.

  • Familiarity with healthcare terminology, CIS systems, and clinical transformation projects.

  • Ability to influence and collaborate with a range of stakeholders.

  • Excellent communication and documentation skills.

  • Strong problem-solving and process analysis capabilities.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior knowledge or experience working within the Nova Scotia Health OPOR program.

  • Graphic design/communications experience is a plus.

  • Background in change management or healthcare IT adoption initiatives.

Work Model:

  • Hybrid role with approximately 70% remote work.

  • Travel across Nova Scotia (up to 30%) as needed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Support ambulatory care design and configuration initiatives.

  • Facilitate strategy execution and knowledge translation to subject matter experts (SMEs).

  • Engage with clinicians to review and validate workflows.

  • Participate in organizational change management and co-facilitate design sessions.

  • Collaborate with Oracle Health consultants and internal project teams.

  • Identify risks/issues and contribute to resolution strategies.

  • Provide ongoing updates to OPOR project leadership.

Requirements:

  • Degree/diploma in a health-related discipline (or equivalent experience).

  • 5+ years of experience in a health-related field.

  • 2+ years in Clinical Informatics or supporting large-scale CIS implementations (Oracle Health/Cerner strongly preferred).

  • Deep understanding of ambulatory/medicine clinic workflows and interdisciplinary coordination.

  • Familiarity with healthcare terminology, CIS systems, and clinical transformation projects.

  • Ability to influence and collaborate with a range of stakeholders.

  • Excellent communication and documentation skills.

  • Strong problem-solving and process analysis capabilities.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior knowledge or experience working within the Nova Scotia Health OPOR program.

  • Graphic design/communications experience is a plus.

  • Background in change management or healthcare IT adoption initiatives.

Work Model:

  • Hybrid role with approximately 70% remote work.

  • Travel across Nova Scotia (up to 30%) as needed.

34110.title: Lead & Senior Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps & Platform Engineering
34110.description:
Lead + Senior Machine Learning Engineer (MLOps & Platform Engineering)
We are seeking a highly experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join a fast-paced, client-facing environment focused on delivering scalable ML solutions. This role is hands-on and deeply technical, involving the modernization and migration of mature ML models within a complex production ecosystem. You’ll be leading architectural efforts, implementing robust MLOps practices, and supporting the integration of ML applications into SaaS platforms. Strong communication skills are essential, as the position requires regular collaboration with stakeholders and mentoring of junior team members.
This opportunity is open exclusively to candidates located in Canada with a solid background in production-grade ML engineering—not recent graduates.

Role/Responsibilities
Platform Engineering & MLOps
  • Architect and deliver ML pipelines end-to-end using tools like Databricks and MLflow.
  • Create and maintain large-scale data processing and feature engineering workflows within Databricks.
  • Automate and manage the full ML lifecycle: model training, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
  • Introduce CI/CD automation with platforms such as GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps.
  • Ensure high availability, security, and scalability across ML workflows.
  • Migrate models to SaaS environments and support cross-platform integrations.
Leadership & Collaboration
  • Act as a technical leader on ML-focused client engagements, driving delivery and alignment with business outcomes.
  • Translate strategic objectives into practical ML implementations and delivery roadmaps.
  • Partner with data scientists, engineers, and product stakeholders to embed ML models into production environments.
  • Mentor junior team members and champion ML engineering best practices across engagements.
ML Application Engineering
  • Convert experimental models into scalable, production-ready solutions.
  • Apply and optimize ML algorithms across a mix of structured and unstructured datasets.
  • Measure model performance, run experiments, and iterate for improvement.
  • Maintain documentation and contribute to internal knowledge-sharing frameworks.
  • Assist with the scale-up and migration of 25+ models in a production environment already housing over 100 ML models.

Experience
Mandatory
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related technical field.
  • Strong academic and practical foundation in ML algorithms, distributed computing, and data engineering.
  • 5+ years in software/data/DevOps engineering roles, with 3+ years specifically in ML engineering or MLOps.
  • Demonstrated experience launching and managing machine learning solutions in production.
  • Expertise with Azure-based ecosystems (Azure ML, Data Lake, AKS, Azure DevOps).
  • Databricks proficiency is a must—especially working with Delta Lake, MLflow, and Apache Spark.
  • Advanced Python coding capabilities and experience with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools and infrastructure-as-code frameworks (e.g., Terraform).
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in Canada and currently residing in the country.
Nice to Have
  • Certifications in Azure or Databricks (e.g., Databricks Certified Professional, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solution Architect).
  • Exposure to LLMs and frameworks like Transformers, TRL, or DeepSpeed.
  • Background in migrating ML models to SaaS platforms.
  • Prior experience in a consulting role, with a track record of effective client engagement.

32662.title: D365 Trainer - SharePoint
32662.description:
Our client is seeking a highly experienced D365 Trainer with SharePoint expertise to support a national training and information management initiative. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Microsoft 365 (D365), SharePoint (on-premise and online), and experience in developing training programs, videos, and instructional content for users across varied departments and time zones. 
Mandatory Active SECRET clearance

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deliver training videos and step-by-step guides for users on SharePoint (on-premise) and Defence 365 features.

  • Build and maintain a SharePoint Online Training site with how-to content, videos, and best practices.

  • Conduct training sessions for new Site Owners using training packages and sandbox environments.

  • Collaborate with the Communications (CO) and Information Management (IM) teams to design onboarding/orientation training for new team members.

  • Design and deploy Power Apps for automating team member intake forms and leadership processes.

  • Create an internal Wiki with approval workflows to replace DWAN-only resources on D365.

  • Support users in navigating the Microsoft Tenant environment post-launch.

  • Perform daily web administration for over 1,200 SharePoint sites.

  • Lead biweekly Information Management Working Groups and L1/L2 sessions to distribute updates and training.

  • Host monthly deployed Information Management sessions for field IMOs.

Qualifications:

  • Proven expertise in D365 and SharePoint (Online & On-Premise)

  • Experience in instructional design and e-learning/training video creation

  • Strong experience with Power Apps and workflow automation

  • Comfortable presenting to and training users of varying technical skill levels

  • Ability to manage and administer large-scale SharePoint environments

  • Active SECRET clearance required

32655.title: Workflow Application Engineer
32655.description:
We are seeking a Workflow Applications Engineer. This role bridges engineering and operations, requiring technical expertise, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for continuous learning. You will design, develop, and implement efficient, automated workflows across a variety of platforms and applications, ensuring smooth integration, optimized performance, and high customer satisfaction.
Essential Functions
  • Design and implement automated workflows tailored to customer requirements.
  • Develop and deliver reliable, scalable solutions using object-oriented principles and API integrations.
  • Program using proprietary tools based on Java and other scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including software engineering, product, and customer service to gather requirements and identify automation opportunities.
  • Ensure seamless integration across cloud and on-premise systems and applications.
  • Monitor application performance for availability and troubleshoot workflow issues as needed.
  • Clearly communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation of workflows, codebases, and technical solutions.
  • Manage multiple concurrent projects, tasks, and requests in a dynamic environment.
Requirements
Required Qualifications and Skills
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
  • Strong grasp of object-oriented programming and coding fundamentals.
  • Hands-on experience with APIs, integrations, scripting, and command-line tools in Linux/Unix environments.
  • Proficient in Java or scripting languages such as Python or Bash.
  • Experience working with XML and JSON data formats.
  • Excellent debugging, testing, and troubleshooting capabilities.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.
  • Familiarity with workflow automation tools and platforms.
  • Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail in multitasking environments.
Preferred Experience
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP and related virtualization strategies.
  • Experience with databases such as PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch.
  • Background in technical support, solution architecture, or project management.
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies or startup environments.
  • Experience in the media, entertainment, publishing, or digital media sectors.
Additional Requirements
  • Availability for occasional work during weekends, nights, or early mornings.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with a customer-focused mindset.
  • Enthusiasm for continuous learning and adapting to emerging technologies.

34107.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps & Platform Engineering
34107.description:
We’re currently seeking a seasoned Machine Learning Engineer who thrives at the intersection of data science, engineering, and operations. This role is ideal for someone who has not only mastered the craft of building and scaling ML solutions, but also knows how to put them into production, and keep them running smoothly.

What You’ll Be Doing:

The role is a mix of MLOps, platform development, and hands-on model engineering. You’ll be responsible for designing automated workflows that take ML models from development to deployment with minimal friction. This includes developing robust CI/CD pipelines (preferably using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions) and managing model lifecycle tasks such as versioning, monitoring, and retraining.

A large portion of your time will be spent working within Databricks—developing feature pipelines, optimizing model workflows, and integrating ML components with existing SaaS systems. You’ll also help migrate and scale models within an environment already hosting over 100 ML models, with another 25+ targeted for transition.

On the application side, you’ll work closely with data scientists to productionalize machine learning prototypes. You’ll select appropriate algorithms, build scalable ML systems using Python-based frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch, and help tune and evaluate performance over time.

The Ideal Candidate Brings:
  • 5+ years of experience in software, data, or DevOps engineering roles—with at least 3 of those focused on MLOps or ML engineering.
  • Expertise in Python, and confidence working with key ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
  • Hands-on experience working in the Microsoft Azure ecosystem—particularly Azure ML, AKS, and Azure DevOps.
  • Deep familiarity with Databricks (including Delta Lake, MLflow, and Apache Spark) is non-negotiable.
  • An understanding of infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform), version control, and CI/CD practices in ML workflows.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally across technical and business teams.
  • You must be located in Canada and able to work with Canadian teams.

Additional:
  • Certifications from Databricks or Microsoft (e.g., Azure Solution Architect).
  • Experience working with LLM libraries or frameworks like transformers, trl, or deepspeed.
  • Prior involvement in ML model migration projects or SaaS ML platform integration.
  • A consulting background or client-facing role where clear communication and stakeholder management were key.

34132.title: Privileged Access Management - PAM – BeyondTrust SMR
34132.description:
Myticas Consulting is actively seeking a Privileged Access Management (PAM) Subject Matter Resource (SMR) specializing in BeyondTrust Password Safe for a 3-month contract engagement with a leading client in the engineering and construction industry.

The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise in PAM technologies, particularly in implementing and managing BeyondTrust solutions, as well as a strong understanding of identity governance frameworks.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement and manage BeyondTrust Password Safe solutions

  • Onboard and integrate applications with BeyondTrust (must have)

  • Ensure compliance with security protocols and governance frameworks

  • Collaborate with IT and security teams to manage privileged access

  • Support governance initiatives and best practices related to PAM

  • (Nice to have) Support and manage CyberArk Self-Hosted solutions

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in PAM or related cybersecurity roles

  • Strong hands-on experience with BeyondTrust Password Safe

  • Proven experience with application onboarding using BeyondTrust

  • Deep understanding of IAM principles and PAM governance frameworks

  • Familiarity with CyberArk Self-Hosted is a strong asset

Certifications (Required/Preferred):

  • BeyondTrust BCIE – Password Safe Certification (Mandatory)

  • CyberArk CDE – Self-Hosted Certification (Preferred)

32659.title: Drupal Developer
32659.description:
The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for an experienced Drupal Developer who would be interested in a long-term remote contract opportunity offered within Canada (originally headquartered in Ottawa, ON).

Previous experience required:

  • Experience building web applications in the Drupal (7) CMS
  • Understands key server-side web development concepts through experiences such as:
  • Interpreting graphic visual or interaction designs in HTML, CSS and Javascript.
  • Creating visually appealing web pages or interfaces.
  • Creating, editing or modifying templates for a CMS or web development framework.
  • Programming interaction with JavaScript and/or a lipary such as jQuery, YUI or Prototype.
  • Testing cross-powser, cross-platform, and/or cross-device compatibility for inconsistencies.
  • Testing for compliance to specified standards such as accessibility standards (WCAG 2.0) in the clients region or domain.
  • Conducting observational user testing, or reviewing designs against usability heuristics.
  • Domain specific knowledge or transferable skills
  • Experience with web development languages of HTML, CSS and JavaScript/jQuery.
  • HTML
    • Familiarity of HTML syntax for multiple specifications, including HTML 5.
    • Knowledge of the semantic meaning of all HTML elements.
    • Familiarity with the semantic markup for display of lists, tabular data, forms, articles, etc.
    • Knowledge of markup used for layout such as dividers.
    • Knowledge at the level to be able to hand-code markup.
    • Including media and images.
  • PHP
    • Familiarity with modifying Drupal Theme hooks to display data
    • Understanding how to utilize PHP to filter, process and output html, json, xml
  • CSS
    • Specifying different CSS for various media, devices and displays.
    • Best practices in CSS file organization and structure.
    • Methods for including CSS inline, internal and external via linked style sheets.
    • How to define, combine and group CSS selectors for HTML elements, ID, classes, pseudo classes, child or sibling.
    • Syntax of CSS declarations, properties and attributes.
    • CSS box model and methods for CSS positioning, absolute and relative.
    • Knowledge of properties and attributes to control the display.
    • Familiarity with differences in CSS 2 and CSS 3.
    • Proficient with a CSS Preprocessor such as Sass or LESS.
  • Best practices
    • Drupal standards and modules
    • Methods to ensure powser & device compatibility
    • Methods for degrading gracefully for older powsers and displays.
    • Methods to ensure accessibility.
    • File compression techniques for improving speed.
  • JavaScript
    • Knowledge of the operators, variables, datatypes, objects, properties and methods.
    • Familiarity with control structures such as objects, functions, conditional statements, arrays, loops and expressions.
    • Forms and regular expression validation and submitting data.
    • Knowledge of how to apply logical operators and conditional statements.
    • Knowledge of the DOM HTML objects and their properties.
    • Event handling.
    • Creating and controlling windows and dialogs.
    • Processes for troubleshooting and debugging
    • Familiarity with development and debugging tools for cross-powser issues.
  • jQuery
    • Knowledge of how to employ the jQuery lipary for visual effects, event handling, and document manipulation.

34080.title: Employment Equity Resource - Federal Job Evaluation & Pay Equity
34080.description:
Our client, a leading federal agency, is seeking an Employment Equity Resource to support a new project related to federal job evaluation and pay equity compliance. This is a confirmed contract win and we are looking to move quickly to identify a qualified consultant. Must have Enhanced Security clearance in place. ON-SITE.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and support job evaluation plans and frameworks to ensure compliance with Federal Pay Equity legislation

  • Collaborate with pay equity committees and union members to facilitate job evaluation and classification discussions

  • Conduct advanced data analysis on compensation and job structure data

  • Create clear and concise reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders

Required Skills & Experience:
