  • Familiarity with working with pay equity committees and/or union groups

  • Strong analytical skills, with a mix of qualitative and quantitative analysis

  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel (advanced formulas, functions, and interconnected worksheets)

  • Experienced in analyzing large, complex data sets

  • Ability to develop polished presentations using Microsoft PowerPoint

Nice to Have:

  • Previous work within federal government job classification systems

  • Bilingual (English/French)

34105.title: MuleSoft Developer & Integration Consultant
34105.description:
Our client is seeking a seasoned MuleSoft Developer & Integration Consultant to join their Integration and Data Management team. The successful candidate will be responsible for redesigning an existing integration model by introducing MuleSoft to interact with SAP systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to redesign integration architecture

  • Develop and implement MuleSoft solutions using Anypoint Platform

  • Build APIs, configure schedulers, and design event-based integration patterns

  • Leverage DataWeave for complex data mapping, transformation, and design

  • Integrate SAP systems with MuleSoft for seamless data exchange

  • Participate in Agile delivery cycles and contribute to architectural planning

  • Support CI/CD processes and version control using modern DevOps tools

Required Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in integration development roles

  • 4+ years of hands-on experience with MuleSoft Anypoint Platform

  • Expertise in MuleSoft APIs, configuration, customization, and patterns

  • Strong proficiency with DataWeave for advanced data mapping

  • Demonstrated experience integrating SAP using MuleSoft

  • Solid understanding of integration architecture and methodologies

  • Proven success delivering large-scale enterprise projects in Agile environments

  • Technical background in Java, HTML, XML, Kafka, GitHub Actions, Confluence, Jira

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

Nice-to-Have:

  • MuleSoft Certified Developer – Level 1 or Level 2

Additional Notes:

  • Preference for candidates located in Calgary with hybrid availability (3 days/week onsite)

  • Remote candidates across Canada will also be considered if not based in Calgary

34103.title: IT Business Analyst – SharePoint & RFP Consultant
34103.description:
IT Business Analyst – SharePoint & RFP Consultant (Contract)
Location:
Ottawa, ON – Hybrid (3 days on-site/week preferred, 1 day remote possible)

Overview:
Our client is seeking a highly skilled IT Business Analyst – SharePoint & RFP Consultant to support the development of a formal Request for Proposal (RFP) for a SharePoint Online implementation. This consultant will serve as the subject matter expert in SharePoint functionality, working closely with senior stakeholders, procurement specialists, and cross-functional teams to define project requirements and ensure an RFP that aligns with strategic goals and compliance standards.

Key Responsibilities:
RFP Development
  • Lead the creation of a clear, structured RFP outlining:
  • Project objectives
  • Scope
  • Functional and technical requirements
  • Timelines, challenges, and budget estimates
  • Ensure training requirements are included for administrators, IT staff, and end users
  • Collaborate with the procurement team to integrate our client’s terms, controls, schedules, and workflows Requirements Gathering & Stakeholder Engagement
    • Review existing documentation (e.g., risk assessments, third-party reports, executive briefings)
    • Facilitate and document stakeholder interviews with Directors, VPs, and SMEs across departments including:
    • Operations, Security, IT, Communications, Major Projects, Finance
  • Define and validate project scope, specifying inclusions/exclusions
  • Ensure consistent communication and consensus across all internal groups SharePoint Capabilities Alignment
    • Translate SharePoint Online capabilities into functional business requirements
    • Assess and prioritize features to be included in the RFP:
    • Intelligent Intranet & Digital Workplace
    • Document Management
    • Workflow Automation
    • Microsoft 365 Integration
    • Governance & Compliance
    • Secure External Collaboration
    • Analytics & Continuous Improvement
    • Low-Code/No-Code Development
    • Change Enablement
    Evaluation & Compliance
    • Partner with procurement to define evaluation criteria for vendor selection
    • Ensure all RFP elements are aligned with  procurement policies and regulatory guidelines
    Quality Assurance
    • Review and refine all RFP content for clarity, accuracy, and professionalism
    • Support finalization of the RFP alongside the Director and Procurement team
    Additional Duties
    • Act as a convenor, bringing stakeholders and ideas together to drive consensus
    • Perform related tasks necessary to support successful delivery of the RFP

    Required Qualifications:
    • 7+ years of experience in IT Business Analysis, preferably in the public or government sector
    • Proven functional SharePoint Online experience
    • Demonstrated expertise in RFP development, especially for IT or platform implementations
    • Experience working with internal procurement teams and stakeholder groups
    • Strong facilitation, interviewing, and consensus-building skills
    • Excellent communication and documentation capabilities
    • Ability to manage ambiguity and guide teams through early-stage requirement gathering

    Nice to Have:
    • Prior experience supporting RFPs involving digital workplace or intranet transformation
    • Familiarity with Microsoft 365 integration projects
    • Understanding of compliance, governance, and security in public sector IT environments

34083.title: Internal Audit Consultant
34083.description:
Our client is seeking three experienced Internal Audit Consultants to support the execution of a high-impact internal audit within the banking sector. The ideal candidates will bring strong expertise in internal audit practices, with a background in banking. Familiarity with Derivatives, Capital Market products, or Counterparty Credit Risk is considered a strong asset.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and support internal audit planning and execution

  • Conduct walkthrough meetings with business stakeholders

  • Perform control testing and validate audit evidence

  • Draft internal audit reports with observations and actionable recommendations

  • Collaborate with audit teams to ensure accurate and timely delivery

Required Skills & Experience:

  • Strong knowledge of financial controls, audit methodology, and risk management

  • Familiarity with Derivatives, Capital Markets, or Credit Risk (nice to have)

  • Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills

Rank: Senior Consultant

Work Model: Hybrid – Toronto-based, 2–3 days onsite per week preferred

34087.title: SAP Data Migration Lead
34087.description:
Myticas Consulting is actively seeking an experienced SAP Data Migration Lead for a high-impact, long-term contract with our client in the natural resources sector. This role is based in Vancouver, BC and follows a hybrid model with 20–30% travel.

The selected candidate will lead the data migration stream as part of an SAP S/4HANA and Ariba implementation. We’re looking for a hands-on leader who can architect, manage, and deliver high-quality data conversion solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the SAP S/4HANA and Ariba data migration stream

  • Manage data conversion activities across the full lifecycle: design, build, test, validation, cutover

  • Set up data migration technical architecture using Syniti ADMM

  • Provide technical direction to the data conversion team

  • Collaborate with functional teams to map and transform source data

  • Conduct data profiling, cleansing, and reconciliation

  • Develop and monitor data quality dashboards and pre/post-validation reports

Required Qualifications:

  • 5–10 years of SAP MDM/Data Migration experience

  • Minimum of 5 full-cycle SAP implementations

  • Expertise with Syniti ADMM (Advanced Data Migration and Management)
    (Candidates with BODS only will be considered after Syniti profiles)

  • Experience loading S/4HANA data using IDOCs, LTMC/LTMOM, LSMW, and custom methods

  • Strong hands-on experience in SQL and data analysis tools

  • Proven knowledge of SAP data objects and functional modules:

  • FI, CO (Record to Report)

  • MM, IM, EWM (Procure to Pay)

  • PM, QM, IBP, PS, HR

Preferred Experience:

  • Data migration project experience in the Energy or Natural Resources sector

  • Deep hands-on knowledge of Syniti ADMM tools:

  • Snapshot Management (data extraction)

  • Quality Module (profiling, dashboards)

  • Syniti Match, Construct, Migrate apps

  • Data migration cockpit and LTMOM

  • Data orchestration and CDC (Change Data Capture)

  • Security features (encryption, masking, user management)

34090.title: Robotic Power Automate Developer
34090.description:
Myticas Consulting is currently seeking 2–3 Robotic Power Automate Developers to support a large-scale data migration project for a confidential financial services client. This is a hybrid role based in Montreal or Toronto, with a preference for Montreal-based candidates. Candidates must be open to periodic travel to Montreal (1–2 times/month, 3–4 days at a time) and working shifts during production events, including some evenings/weekends.

Project Scope:

The successful candidates will develop, optimize, and deploy automation workflows using Power Automate Desktop (RPA) and SQL. The role focuses on data transformation and integration into legacy mainframe systems, supporting business-critical migration activities with high compliance and quality standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and deploy automation workflows using Power Automate Desktop (RPA)

  • Collaborate with business and data teams to translate migration requirements into automated processes

  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and data validations

  • Automate ETL processes for integration with mainframe environments

  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve workflow issues

  • Ensure security, compliance, and maintain clear documentation and audit trails

  • Participate in key migration events and be available for shift-based support when needed

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in Power Automate Desktop (RPA) development

  • Experience with Power Platform (solution creation and deployments)

  • Strong SQL development skills, including stored procedures and performance tuning

  • Previous experience with mainframe data integration or loading

  • Understanding of RPA architecture, workflow orchestration, and automation lifecycle

  • Experience working in Agile or hybrid project settings

  • Strong communication and troubleshooting skills

Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with Power Automate Cloud flows or Power Platform integrations

  • Knowledge of SSIS, ADF, Informatica, or middleware tools

  • Exposure to COBOL datasets or legacy batch processing

  • Experience with data mapping and transformation logic

32657.title: Technical Manager Customer Support
32657.description:
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Support Manager to lead a team
of talented Technical Support Engineers responsible for providing world-class customer support.

This individual will be accountable for managing daily support operations, coaching and
mentoring team members, driving operational excellence, and building a customer-first culture
that ensures exceptional satisfaction, retention, and long-term success. The ideal candidate will
bring a deep understanding of technical support operations, a background in networking or SaaS
platforms, and a passion for solving customer problems with empathy and urgency.
Core Responsibilities
• Lead and inspire a team of Technical Support Engineers to drive product knowledge, support
excellence, and professional development.
• Manage the day-to-day operations of the support organization, ensuring key performance
indicators such as customer satisfaction, response times, and ticket resolution rates are
consistently met or exceeded.
• Act as the primary point of contact for customer technical escalations, ensuring timely and
effective resolution of complex or high-priority issues.
• Analyze team metrics, SLAs, and customer support trends to implement scalable strategies that
improve response quality and operational efficiency.
• Proactively research and adopt new support tools and technologies that enhance team productivity
and service quality.
• Support career growth and retention through coaching, mentoring, and continuous learning
opportunities.
• Promote and enforce best practices, process improvements, and documentation standards
across the team.
• Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to escalate
systemic issues and prioritize long-term fixes.
• Lead customer-facing support reviews and QBRs, ensuring open communication around issue
trends, resolution plans, and areas of improvement.
• Translate technical feedback and customer pain points into actionable product or
documentation enhancements.
Required Qualifications and Skills
• 7+ years of relevant experience in technical support or customer success roles, including
experience managing escalations.
• Demonstrated success leading support teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.
• Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, with the capacity to engage both technical
and non-technical audiences.
• Solid understanding of networking concepts and tools used in network troubleshooting.
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline (or equivalent
experience).
• Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a high-pressure environment.
• Proven track record of proactively identifying risks and implementing mitigation strategies.

32383.title: Senior FPGA Verification Developer
32383.description:
SENIOR FPGA VERIFICATION DEVELOPER

The ideal candidate is an integral part of our product development team, driving the creation of world-leading next-generation broadcast video processing technology. You focus on developing and maintaining an FPGA product verification test suite to ensure the highest quality designs and enable cross-functional teams to achieve the same. You actively participate in all phases of FPGA development—from specification and design to verification and customer support—with a primary focus on ensuring product reliability and performance through rigorous testing. You collaborate closely with FPGA and software development teams, as well as DevOps engineers, to align verification methodologies and streamline integration efforts for efficiency and quality. You are highly proficient in FPGA verification, with expertise in VHDL or Verilog (preferred) and SystemVerilog, and have a solid understanding of RTL design and implementation. Additionally, you excel in Python scripting for test automation within a DevOps framework. You thrive in hands-on work with hardware products and are eager to contribute to multiple facets of product design and verification. 

Who you report to:  Sr. Manager, Hardware Development – IP Solutions


What the job is all about:
  • Develop, write, and maintain test cases for FPGA product verification as part of the DevOps automation framework.
  • Collaborate with FPGA design engineers, software developers, and DevOps teams to enhance and integrate the automation framework environment.
  • Create and maintain FPGA verification test suites, ensuring comprehensive coverage and robust testing of functionality.
  • Work hands-on with hardware products to verify functionality and debug issues in collaboration with cross-functional teams.
  • Generate and maintain documentation, test plans, and reports to track and ensure product quality and reliability.
  • Support Product Verification (PV) and Quality Assurance (QA) teams throughout development—validating feedback, diagnosing issues, and assisting in debugging and resolving hardware and system-level problems.
  • Participate actively in Agile Scrum ceremonies such as stand-ups, retrospectives, refinement, and sprint planning.
  • Contribute to FPGA verification and validation tasks, leveraging expertise in VHDL/Verilog (preferred) and SystemVerilog to ensure high-quality designs. 
 
Who you are:
  • Proficient in FPGA verification tools and methodologies, including Universal Verification Methodology (UVM).
  • In-depth knowledge of scripting languages (Python preferred, along with Tcl, Perl, or Bash) for test automation and environment setup.
  • Familiarity with FPGA vendor tools such as Xilinx Vivado, Altera Quartus, and related simulation environments like ModelSim or QuestaSim.
  • Experience with verification frameworks and tools from industry vendors (Cadence, Synopsys, Mentor).
  • Good understanding of RTL debugging and verification using VHDL/Verilog and SystemVerilog.

  • Familiarity with FPGA interconnect protocols, including Avalon, AXI, and high-speed interfaces such as PCI Express, Ethernet (1/10/25/100GE), 12G-SDI, HDMI, and DisplayPort.
  • Experience working with high-speed transceivers, timing recovery, and synchronization.
  • Knowledge of revision control systems like Git, including branching and tagging methodologies.
  • Strong understanding of digital video, audio, and associated standards (a plus).
  • Additional experience with C/C++ for verification or hardware-software co-design (a plus).
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of balancing aggressive timelines with quality outcomes.
  • Demonstrated ability to learn quickly, think creatively, and solve challenging problems.
  • Knowledge or experience in video/audio technologies and standards (preferred).
  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or related field required
  • Minimum 5 years of FPGA development experience, with an emphasis on verification.

32549.title: FPGA Developer, Senior
32549.description:
Overview:
A leading provider of real-time video processing technology is seeking a Senior FPGA Developer to join its core signal processing team. This group is responsible for developing high-performance media transport and processing systems used by global clients in live production, broadcast, and media environments.

This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge, high-bandwidth systems built on advanced FPGA platforms—delivering critical real-time features that enable professional-grade media production. You’ll be surrounded by a highly experienced team that values innovation, collaboration, and practical problem solving.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement RTL for advanced real-time media systems with interfaces including memory, PCIe, and hardware-accelerated video processing.

  • Develop transport protocol implementations (e.g., SDI, SMPTE 2110) within FPGAs.

  • Collaborate on system architecture—reviewing schematics, optimizing clocking, thermal considerations, and FPGA resource allocation.

  • Perform full IO ring designs for leading FPGA families (e.g., Arria10, Stratix-10, Ultrascale+, Agilex).

  • Define and document high-level system requirements; support component selection and scheduling.

  • Create simulation testbenches (Verilog/SystemVerilog); perform functional verification and debugging.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with software, hardware, and manufacturing teams through the full product lifecycle.

  • Mentor peers and support technical knowledge sharing within the team.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of hands-on FPGA design experience, preferably with exposure to video or audio systems.

  • Strong Verilog/SystemVerilog and scripting skills (TCL).

  • Experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGAs and their respective toolchains (Quartus, Vivado).

  • Familiarity with high-speed serial interfaces, DDR3/4, HBM, PLLs, and signal integrity principles.

  • Excellent debugging and validation skills; proficiency with lab tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Background in embedded systems (Linux, bash, C/C++) considered a plus.

  • Understanding of media production workflows and digital video standards (SMPTE, HDR, SDI) is advantageous.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced engineering environment.

32444.title: Legal Invoice Analyst Initial Reviewer
32444.description:
Bill Rate: $40/hr; 

Location:  Hybrid role, Minneapolis, MN 55402

Job Description:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I will be responsible for the prompt, accurate and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices submitted by law firms and vendors of our clients. The candidate will be responsible for making adjustments to invoice line item entries, where those line-item entries violate provisions of the relevant billing guidelines and documenting the justification for such adjustments. The Legal Invoice Analyst I will provide guidance to business unit partners regarding issues or opportunities within the LBA process.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
• Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist and/or work the intake queue for self-assignments.
• Verify the compliance to legal billing guidelines by law firms and vendor submitting invoices.
• Verify the accuracy of the UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
• Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, identifying the billing guideline violated and the rationale for the amount adjusted.
• Forward the audited legal bill through the review chain as required.
• Communicate and calibrate with Legal Invoice Analyst and Quality Assurance Analyst team members.
• Excellent ability to review, analyze and evaluate legal fee and cost/expense invoice entries and to exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
• Strong understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
• Self-motivated with an ability to work independently and with very limited supervision after training.
• Excellent computer skills with the ability to learn the electronic legal bill submission and auditing software.
• Organizational skills, including the ability to organize work in an orderly fashion conducive to the prompt, efficient review of an appropriate number of legal invoices in a given day or time period.
• Familiarity with common business math and possess appropriate business telephone skills.

Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience:
Minimum: Paralegal Certification or Bachelor’s Degree in legal related discipline and/or equivalent work experience. 
Minimum Experience: 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
Tools: Microsoft Office Suite ( Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
• Experience with legal billing processes.
• Firm understanding of the federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.
• Team Work: Must work collaboratively with people within LBACOE and throughout the entire WK organization, while providing constructive feedback to LBACOE from the BUs.
• Problem Solving: Capable of independent thinking and rendering sound decisions. Astute at identifying and engaging the necessary resources to help in decision making. Takes quick actions to identify and resolve the cause of any problem. Proactive in nature.
• Leadership: Exhibits individual control over day to day responsibilities as well as the ability to work collaboratively with other BUs to produce results.
• Planning and Organizing: Must be able to implement plans with the purpose of achieving short and long term goals. Must be able to prioritize in order to accomplish these goals in a given time period.
• Technology: Has the ability to partner with experts in the technology field to identify technology gaps and requirements necessary to develop position and impactful solutions.
• Learning: Ability to acquire new or modify existing knowledge to support a changing market place and workforce. Can demonstrate a capability to learn by study, experience, or instruction.
 • Initiative and Enterprise: Is self-directed and has the ability to translate ideas into action and get things done.

Job Description

One of our Direct clients is looking to add a Seasoned Sr Business Systems Consultant to their team, to support in-flight system development (custom build) and enhancement projects, complete contracting / pre-SLC assessments for new projects, assess new business capability requests and coordinate technical teams to deliver the capabilities.

  • Track record of successful GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems.

  • Clinical experience strongly preferred

Job Description

One of our Direct clients is looking to add a Seasoned Sr Business Systems Consultant to their team, to support in-flight system development (custom build) and enhancement projects, complete contracting / pre-SLC assessments for new projects, assess new business capability requests and coordinate technical teams to deliver the capabilities. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Initiate and Plan Project:
  • Collaborate with business and IT management to establish project goals, objectives, financials, and deliverables.
  • Build and manage the project plan, resources, and Gantt charts to accomplish the project scope.
  • Project Control and Quality Management:
  • Evaluate scope changes, issues, and risks, working with stakeholders to resolve them.
  • Measure performance against the original plan and budget, ensuring compliance with corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Maintain and update the RAID log to track project risks, actions, and issues.
  • Execute and Close Project:
  • Develop and execute work plans, securing authorized resources to complete all activities.
  • Lead the team in delivering the project scope, gather lessons learned, and obtain final project approval.
  • Assist in managing the process to ensure all validation deliverables are completed.
  • Project Communication:
  • Produce and distribute project reports to provide accurate status and decision support to stakeholders.
  • Make recommendations to resolve issues and manage risks based on the current project status.
  • Resource and Team Management:
  • Coordinate and assign resources to ensure project needs are met, effectively assign tasks based on team members’ abilities.
  • Motivate the project team to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Decisions and Financial Control:
  • Make decisions impacting project-level activities; influence or have authority over the project budget.
  • Develop and manage a financial plan, maintaining spend within +/- 10% of the overall budget.
  • Track and update financials in Clarity, coordinating estimates and invoices with vendors.
  • Vendor Coordination:
  • Coordinate vendor activities and ensure timely milestone delivery.
  • Ensure vendor purchase orders (POs) are processed promptly.
  • Project Meetings:
  • Facilitate Project Management meetings to oversee execution activities with IT System Owner and Principal Business Systems Consultant.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • Strong Business Systems Analysis experience
  • 5-10 years of experience in Information Technology project management.
  • Experience SLC - System lifecycle, change request.
  • GXP system experience required - GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems.
  • Portfolio / Program management experience.
  • Clinical Systems
  • Flexibility needed while collaborating with the global project team and vendors (eg 7 AM meetings and /or 4 pm meetings).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.

- Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
- Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
- Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

Job Summary:
The client is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Project Manager to lead complex, large-scale IT initiatives. This role requires a strong blend of project management expertise, leadership capabilities, technical awareness, and change management proficiency to ensure successful project outcomes aligned with business objectives and enterprise standards.

Myticas's direct client is seeking Project Manager for 12+ Months Contract role. (Potential of Extension).

IMPORTANT NOTE: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. Local candidates only - Candidates must be located within 2 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission.

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- 5+ years overall experience
- Experience with the ADKAR (Prosci) Framework
- Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
- Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
- Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
- Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

Job Summary:
The State of Michigan is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Project Manager to lead complex, large-scale IT initiatives. This role requires a strong blend of project management expertise, leadership capabilities, technical awareness, and change management proficiency to ensure successful project outcomes aligned with business objectives and enterprise standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide strategic oversight, leadership, and accountability for one or more large, complex IT projects, typically lasting longer than 6 months, involving 20 or more team members, and requiring executive-level communication and coordination.
  • Ensure alignment with State of Michigan project management methodologies, including SUITE, investment management, and systems engineering methodology.
  • Lead cross-functional teams through all phases of project planning and execution, including the development of integrated schedules, risk management plans, and budget tracking.
  • Monitor and report on project progress regarding scope, quality, schedule, and budget, and escalate issues and risks to executive leadership as necessary.
  • Perform long-term release planning to support organizational strategic goals and ensure alignment with broader enterprise initiatives.
  • Evaluate technical requirements in collaboration with IT and business stakeholders, proposing solutions that meet business needs while adhering to SOM best practices and industry standards.
  • Apply structured change management practices grounded in the ADKAR (Prosci) framework to ensure stakeholder alignment and successful adoption of project deliverables.


Technical Competencies:
  • Strong knowledge of APIs, system interfaces, and multi-system integrations across complex IT environments.
  • Working knowledge of IT infrastructure components and their interactions within networked environments (e.g., firewalls, VIPs, F5 listeners, ports).
  • Familiarity with core infrastructure environments including networks, servers, storage, web platforms, and virtual/cloud solutions.
  • Ability to effectively collaborate with technical teams and external vendors to support solution design, integration, deployment, and issue resolution.


Change Management and Stakeholder Engagement: This position plays a critical role in driving change adoption through:
  • Integration of change management principles from the outset of the project.
  • Close collaboration with stakeholder engagement leads to develop and implement communication plans, facilitate training sessions, and monitor organizational readiness.
  • Supporting stakeholders at every level to reduce resistance, align expectations, and ensure long-term user adoption of new systems and processes.


Ideal Candidate Profile:
  • Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
  • Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
  • Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
  • Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

32632.description:
Job Title: Business Systems Analyst with QA
Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite)
Duration: 5 months (with a possibility of extension)
Bill Rate: $90hr

Description
The BSA/QA will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. This individual will work closely with the project team and stakeholders to understand their business requirements and do document them in User Stories to then be developed. The BSA/QA will create test cases for user stories and will execute these tests and clearly documenting results and creating defects where needed.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document detailed business requirements and functional specifications.
  • Analyze existing business processes, identify areas for improvement, and evaluate potential solutions to increase efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Assist in the design and implementation of software solutions that meet the business needs and integrate with existing systems where necessary.
  • Develop test plans and coordinate testing efforts to ensure that solutions meet business requirements and provide a high level of quality.
  • Create and maintain comprehensive documentation including process flows, business rules, and user guides.
  • Work closely with project managers and other team members to ensure timely delivery of project milestones and resolution of any issues that may arise.
  • Serve as a liaison between the IT department and business units by communicating project status, changes, and potential impacts to stakeholders.
  • Perform manual testing of software applications to ensure they meet user requirements.
  • Extensive experience on different types of testing that includes Functional testing, System Integration testing, Regression testing and UAT.
  • Experience in Agile/Scrum Environments on multiple Projects.
  • Experience in developing test plans, strategies, and test Scenarios.
  • Create, execute, and maintain test cases and test scripts. Collaborate with the development team to address and resolve identified issues in a timely manner.
  • Expertise in using JIRA for writing the Test Cases and tracking the Defects.
  • Excellent Communication skills-Verbal and written.

34225.title: Windchill Solutions Consultant
34225.description:
We are looking for a Windchill professional who knows Java.  Not a Java developer that has worked in Windchill.
most important exp is with Windchill (both tech work but also understanding the business processes that the tool supports).  Looking for exp leading implementation of ProjectLink and/or SUMA, not just participating in the implementation.

Windchill Solutions Consultant
We are seeking a Windchill solutions consultant to support the deliverables of our global team and initiatives. As a member of our team, using Agile practices, you will lead us to timely delivery of high-quality technical solutions that drive cross functional business strategies and initiatives.

What You Will Be Doing:
Key Responsibilities:
  • Envisioning, implementing and supporting solutions (technical or non-technical) to resolve business problems or improve business processes
  • Building relationships with and consulting with client groups
  • Developing system requirements and identifying alternatives for solutions that use PLM technologies  
Specifically:
  • Implement functionality for Supplier Collaboration through Windchill ProjectLink and Supplier Management (SUMA).
  • Assist in other PLM initiatives involving MPMLink & Process Plans, Plant/Enterprise Data, and our SAP S4 to Windchill Migration
 
Key Skills/Abilities
  • Knowledge and understanding of Product Life Cycle Management business processes
  • Deep Windchill background that includes Workflow Design, Type and Attribute Management, Container Strategy and Access Control Policies, Object Initialization Rules, Life Cycle Definition, Team Templates, Change Process and Templates, Vaulting and Replication, Queue Management, 3D Publishing, CAD Data Management, XBOM Management, Visual Work instructions, Parts Classification, Installation, Preferences and Properties, etc. 
Technical Components of the position includes such tools and technologies as: 
·PTC Products:  Windchill, Creo, ThingWorx
·ERP Systems:  SAP ECC, SAP S/4
·Programming Skills:  Java, JavaScript, SQL
·Other:  MS Office Suite, MS Azure DevOps
 
Minimum Qualifications
·Bachelor’s Degree in a related field required. 
·Five years of experience working with Windchill and PLM business processes.
·Experience with integration between Windchill and ERP systems.
·Experience implementing ProjectLink for supplier collaboration.
·Experience implementing Windchill SUMA for supplier management.
Experience working in an Agile (SCRUM) environment preferred

34098.title: Cyber Posture Management Analyst
34098.description:
Job Purpose

 

The Cyber Posture Mgmt. Analyst I, as a part of Jackson Information Security & Privacy, provides security analysis for the company's Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operation's program. This role requires knowledge across multiple platforms, applications, processes, and procedures to enable access management of business initiatives across the enterprise.

 

Essential Responsibilities

 

  • Familiar with identity and access management, with a focus on Privileged Access Management (PAM), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and Identity Governance and Administration (IGA).

  • Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Python) for automation and customization of IAM solutions.

  • Understanding of identity protocols and technologies: OpenID Connect (OIDC,) OAuth, SAML, AD-Fed, API Gateways, SCIM, and platforms such as, Sailpoint, CyberArk, and MS Entra.

  • Knowledge of identity & access management vulnerabilities, threats and mitigations.

  • Ability to determine how a security system works (including its resilience and dependability capabilities) and how changes in conditions, operations, or the environment will affect these outcomes.

  • Familiar with modern software life cycle development and automated cloud infrastructure deployment.

  • Understanding of network architecture, operating systems, and security protocols.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

  • Supports initiatives and projects that will improve the organization’s cyber posture.

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Understanding of security controls, risk management, and regulatory compliance (NIST CSF/SOX/GDPR/etc.).

 

Other Duties

 

  • Extended hours, including on-call may be required.

  • Performs other duties and/or projects as assigned.

 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

 

  • Ability to receive and incorporate feedback.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Strong attention to detail.

  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

  • Flexibility in day-to-day work.

  • Ability to learn the company’s supported systems and their interfaces with other systems.

  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft software applications.

  • Ability to communicate technical concepts in an understandable fashion.

  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and execute efficiently and effectively while demonstrating a clear sense of urgency when appropriate.

  • Excellent customer service focus and skills.

  • Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment to achieve desired results.

  • Scripting knowledge preferred.

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience and/or education required.

  • 1+ years knowledge of financial products, regulatory requirements, and business process preferred.

  • Cloud Identity experience preferred.

  • SC-300 Microsoft Certified Identity and Access Administrator Associate preferred.

  • CISSP Certified Information Systems Security Professional preferred.

34075.title: Senior Data Warehouse Business Analyst
34075.description:
• Analyze existing data sources and business processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.
  • Translate business needs into detailed functional and technical specifications for data warehouse development.
  • Support the design and implementation of ETL processes, interfaces, data marts, reports, and data analytics.

Functional Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst to support a large-scale Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) project. This role will serve as a critical liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that data warehouse solutions align with business goals. This role involves gathering and translating business requirements into functional specifications, supporting data modeling efforts, and facilitating testing and validation of data warehouse deliverables.
 
Primary Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with business users, data engineers, and BI developers to define and document business and data requirements.
  • Analyze existing data sources and business processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.

  • Ability to work in a challenging environment with multiple teams and competing priorities

32563.title: Digital Marketing Consultant
32563.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Digital Marketing Consulting to support Search Engine Optimization activities.  This is an ON-SITE role starting as a 5 months contract, with likely extensions.  Candidates local to the Grand Rapids area, are preferred. Qualified candidates please provide resume.  Thank you!
 
Job Description (Visible to Supplier): Digital Marketing Contractor – Job Responsibilities

In response to evolving digital marketing priorities and the growing importance of AI in search, we are expanding the role of our current SEO lead and seeking a Digital Marketing Contractor to provide support for core SEO responsibilities. This role will help ensure continuity in execution and performance monitoring while allowing the team to focus on broader strategic initiatives. The contractor will support global SEO operations and partner with market teams to enhance visibility, discoverability, and performance across digital properties.

Duration: July – December 2025, with potential extension
Location: Grand Rapids, MI (Onsite)
Reports to: Global SEO Lead

Key Responsibilities

Operational SEO Execution
• Conduct keyword research to support market-level needs and content planning.
• Perform technical SEO audits using tools like Ahrefs and Google Search Console.
• Support content optimization efforts, including metadata, on-page structure, and internal linking.
• Compile and deliver monthly SEO performance reports using platforms such as Ahrefs, Heap, and GSC.
• Troubleshoot SEO issues reported by markets and provide actionable solutions.
• Leverage AI tools and approaches to generate recommendations for content optimization, keyword discovery, link-building, and landing page refinement.
• Integrate AI-enabled tools to automate repetitive SEO tasks and improve execution speed and scalability.

SEO Training and Enablement
• Assist in delivering SEO onboarding sessions and office hours for market teams.
• Help maintain and update SEO playbooks, best practices, and documentation on SharePoint.
• Create or revise modular self-serve resources to enable independent market optimization.
• Support the creation and management of a centralized SharePoint hub for training.

Performance Monitoring and Insights
• Support organic search sentiment analysis and reputation tracking.
• Monitor and extract insights from dashboards (Heap, Ahrefs) to identify trends and risks.
• Assist in evaluating SEO impact for major product launches and post-launch performance reviews.
• Apply AI-powered tools to surface deeper insights from large-scale performance data.

Collaboration and Coordination
• Work cross-functionally with content, analytics, and technical teams to integrate SEO best practices.
• Participate in global team meetings or planning sessions to ensure SEO considerations are included.
• Escalate technical SEO issues or strategic risks to the Global SEO Lead.

Tool and Vendor Support
• Assist with user access management, licensing coordination, and onboarding for SEO tools.
• Support evaluations of SEO tool usage and effectiveness.
• Coordinate with vendors to troubleshoot issues or implement platform improvements.

?

Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in digital marketing and hands-on SEO in global or multi-market settings.
• Proficiency with SEO tools like Heap, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, and Lumar (or equivalent).
• Strong analytical skills; able to turn performance data into clear, actionable insights.
• Excellent writing and editing skills, with an understanding of search-optimized content.
• Demonstrated experience creating or reviewing metadata, headers, and on-page copy for SEO.
• Familiarity with CMS platforms and technical SEO concepts (indexing, crawling, Core Web Vitals).
• Strong understanding of how AI can be applied to SEO (e.g., prompt engineering, content summarization, automated content audits, keyword clustering).
• Experience working with cross-functional teams across content, marketing, and tech.
• Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

32619.title: IT Infrastructure Manager - Manufacturing
32619.description:
Piston Automotive is seeking an IT Plant Manager for our Orion, MI facility. This role is crucial in managing all IT-related activities at the local plant, with key responsibilities encompassing infrastructure, manufacturing software, and business operations. As a key member of the Plant Leadership Team, the IT Plant Manager will play an integral role in supporting continuous improvement initiatives and shaping the local plant culture.

 

Piston Automotive wasn’t just founded to make things. It was founded to make things better. And that begins with building better teams solely dedicated to achieving excellence at every level of execution through a combination of experience, expertise, and a deep seeded passion for what we do. Our assemblies consistently set the standard because our people consistently raise the bar.

 

Why Piston Automotive?

Competitive Wages, Paid Holidays & Vacation, Medical & Rx Plans, Dental & Vision Plans, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, Employee Assistance Program, Life & Disability Coverage, 401K with Company Match, Tuition Reimbursement , Vehicle and Product Discounts

Responsibilities

  • Manage daily IT activity at plant level including employee related issues.
  • Assist in budget (cap-ex/allocation) for plant and corporate level.
  • Maintain budget for plant related IT expenses.
  • Provide direct supervision for IT Plant Support Specialist assigned to respective plant.
  • Manages the third-party maintenance for network, hardware, software, and telecommunications services.
  • Participate in budget planning, implementation, and monitoring for purchase and maintenance of hardware and software for the plant
  • Prepare plans for applications, physical infrastructure and the acquisition of the necessary resources to support these items and assure responsiveness of the plans relating to corporate objectives.
  • Manages installation of hardware and software by others.
  • Manage provisioning of end user workstations/laptops based on Corporate standards.
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   

Qualifications

  • A minimum of six years of experience in an IT Manager role.:
  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related field
  • Six (6) years of experience creating strategic plans
  • A minimum of four (4) years of experience working with cross-functional teams
  • Four (4) years of experience managing a budget
  • A minimum of 4 years of project management experience
  • A minimum of three (3) years of experience training and developing direct reports
  • Six (6) years of organization and planning experience
    • A minimum of six years of experience with the following technical skills:
    • SQL Server database software
    • Microsoft operating systems and Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access)
    • VMWare
    • PC
    • RF
    • Printing
    • Server
    • Network Storage systems
    • Knowledge of networking
    • Backup technologies to support troubleshooting efforts
    • Industry based IT tools
    • Must be able to regularly lift and/or move up to 30 pounds.

  • PREFERRED SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:

    Familiarity with:

  • IT automotive systems
  • ERP such as Plex
  •  
  • MES
  • Plant floor applications and networks preferred.

32643.title: Manufacturing Engineer
32643.description:
MANUFACTURING ENGINEER - willing to consider all experience levels - temp to hire is target plan but NOT guaranteed.  

Grand Rapids, MI - On-site.  Contract or Contract to Hire

Planned 2nd shift hours of 4pm-12pm/1am, to support production.

We are hiring Associate to Sr. Manufacturing Engineer to lead and provide ongoing support through our manufacturing life cycle!

What You Will Be Doing:
With general direction, will lead the introduction of new products into the facility, improve productivity and profitability of existing production procedures, and provide ongoing support through the manufacturing life cycle. Acts as a technical expert in process technology

Improvements: Independently, with innovation and creativity, evaluates manufacturing processes to ensure optimal labor and material costs to increase productivity and profitability. Through justifications and evaluations, identifies prime areas for improvement. Tracks expenditures to ensure outlays are within budgeted amounts. Identifies, reduces, and eliminates worker exposure(s) to ergonomic stress(es) in the work place.

Floor Support: Provides timely product and process support for any manufacturing area to diagnose problems and implement solutions to minimize interruptions to production.

Special Projects: Leads the implementation of significant product, process, or other corporate change initiatives being introduced into the plant.

Strategic/Manufacturing Planning: Provides advanced research to introduce/integrate new processes, equipment, and technologies into the company

Your future team:??
You will be part of large and collaborative operations network at Steelcase.

Who You Are:
Preferred Skills and Competencies
  • Very strong analysis skills: process, capacity, cost/benefit, waste stream, and quality tools.
  • Internal and external quality support/management
  • Knowledge in lean manufacturing techniques: flow, PQ, equipment reliability, and set up reduction.
  • Facilitation and negotiation skills
  • Knowledge of material handling
  • Productivity improvement techniques: RCI’s
  • Behavior sciences (logic, sociology, etc.)
  • Economics and financial analysis
  • Work measurement
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Computer skills; advanced level required to utilize Excel and Access programs
  • Experience in design, specification, purchase, and installation of new equipment
  • Experience in the Engineering Design Process
  • Knowledge of simulation, process modeling, and value stream mapping
  • Project management and leadership ability
  • Occupational Bio Mechanics/Human Factors Engineering
  • Strategic planning

Required Skills and Competencies
  • 4 year technical degree or equivalent education 

Who We Are: 

Steelcase is a global design and thought leader in the world of work. Along with our expansive community of brands, we design and manufacture innovative furnishings and solutions to help people do their best work in the many places where work happens. 

Why People Choose to Work with Us:   

At Steelcase, we put people at the center of everything we do. We understand the role of work and believe that it can bring meaning and purpose to the lives of our customers and our employees. We prioritize supporting our employees both in and out of work, in all aspects of their lives. When we bring our talents together, we make a positive lasting impact through our work and communities.    

Our employees balance two key principles: 

We expect the office to be our primary place of work because that’s where we gather to learn, teach, innovate, and host our clients. Being present together builds communities of belonging, enables strong teams, and helps us make meaningful progress. 

We also believe in giving people choice and control – over how, when and where they work to achieve commitments and deliver results, along with their wellbeing and personal needs. We trust employees to orchestrate their time and presence to best accomplish work, and what that looks like may change from day to day. 

 Levels of flexibility vary by role and team, and employees and their leader need to align on expectations of flexibility.  Together we can help the world work better.

32581.title: Technical Support and Customer Service Associate
32581.description:
COLLEGIS CUSTOMER SERVICE ASSOCIATE (CSA) JOB DESCRIPTION
Position Summary:

The Customer Service Associate serves as the front line to the PSC.  They are actively fielding calls, emails and chats with a goal of exceeding established service level agreements. Customer Service Associate will perform first level problem determination and troubleshooting as well as attempt to implement a resolution. If additional access or a higher level of knowledge about the environment is required to implement a solution the Tier 1 agent will utilize appropriate escalation processes to transition the caller to the correct path for resolution of their reported concern.  Customer Service Associate is managed on their performance, customer service, and continued commitment to success and learning.  Customer Service Associate will be granted access to a comprehensive knowledgeable base to assist them with resolution of problems as well as various training sessions to attend.

In addition to Telephone Support, Customer Service Associate will also help support customers through Chat and Email Mediums simultaneously.  The support department runs 24x7x365 and Customer Service Associate may work varied shifts that could include nights, weekends, and holidays. Assignments of duties and daily tasks can change on a regular basis and focus can be reflected in a change in accounts supported.

Primary Responsibilities, Essential Functions and Requirements:

Communication & Professionalism:

The Customer Service Associate’s role is one that supports various clientele in technical and non-technical scenarios. Maintaining excellent customer service and professional communication is critical to the success of individuals within this position.

Be accountable for seeing assigned cases and tasks to completion by providing detailed documentation all details and troubleshooting steps taken for each support request to eliminate repetitive steps.
Triage with upper level agents to determine appropriate case resolution measures and implementation of solutions.
Ensure professional and respectful communication is maintained in all interactions including face to face, over the phone, via email, and chat correspondences.
 
Teamwork & Collaboration:

Teamwork and collaboration with PSC employees and outside departments are critical elements to being successful within the PSC.  The Customer Service Associate is a focal point for all inbound activities and it is critical to convey and maintain a collaborative environment to ensure the support requests are resolved in a proper and positive manner.  It is of utmost importance that PSC staff members maintain a reassuring and positive atmosphere for the caller.

Proactively work with PSC employees and PSC Leadership to better understand supported environments as well as fostering a collaborative partnership.
Work with Technical Support Analysts as well as other departments to escalate support requests in the event that a resolution cannot be found at the Customer Service Associate level.
Focus on the understanding of as well as meeting and exceeding customer service level agreements and customer satisfaction ratings.
Work with PSC Leadership to implement new initiatives and practice coaching requests.
Maintain an active approach to utilizing the Wiki and suggest updates when necessary. Consult Technical Support Analyst, Technical Service Solutions Specialist or leadership when discrepancies are found so corrections and additional research may be put forth to better the tools utilized within the PSC.
Participate in Technical Support Analyst mentoring program and perform peer assigned mentoring of Technical Support Analyst agents.
Continued development of knowledge and utilization of PSC support tool sets.
 
Commitment to Learning:

The PSC is a place in which systems and support models rapidly change. Support topics can vary on a day-to-day basis but can include PC & MAC troubleshooting (Hardware, Software, Network Connectivity, etc.), assisting with navigation and proper function of a Learning Management System (Online School Environment), as well as other current and future topics that will be introduced on a consistent basis.  Being able to quickly learn these environments and manage the day-to-day variance is critical. Following and participating in the development of internal Personal Support Center policies and procedures will ensure a consistent approach to case management.

Take advantage of knowledge sharing sessions, online knowledge bases, standard operating procedures, and communication with other departments. Complete a minimum of 3 training sessions per quarter.
Collaboration with PSC Leadership to suggest updates to department Knowledge Base (Wiki)
Commitment to reviewing all training communications, coaching opportunities, as well as continual review and reflection upon all PSC information content sources. Such as Wiki, SharePoint, and other department websites.
32581.publicDescription:
Technical Support and Customer Service Associate - REMOTE

Contract: 12 months with possible CTH
Schedule: 3rd shift - 12 am to 9 am, Tuesday thru Saturday
Work Type: Fully Remote

Myticas is actively seeking a Technical Support and Customer Service Associate for a direct client to join their Personal Support Center (PSC) team. This role is perfect for someone with a passion for helping others, a knack for troubleshooting, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, tech-forward environment.

As a PSC Associate, you’ll be the first point of contact for users via phone, email, and chat—working to resolve technical issues, answer questions, and ensure a seamless customer experience. You'll be supported by extensive training, a detailed knowledge base, and a collaborative team ready to help you grow.

What You’ll Do:
  • Provide Tier 1 technical support for software, hardware, and connectivity issues
  • Assist with password resets, software installations, VPN setups, and general troubleshooting
  • Escalate complex issues to senior team members when needed
  • Maintain clear, professional communication across all customer interactions
  • Simultaneously manage support requests via phone, email, and chat
  • Accurately log cases using tools like ServiceNow and Zendesk
What We’re Looking For:
  • Strong customer service and communication skills
  • Comfort working in a flexible, 24/7/365 support environment
  • Ability to adapt to new tools, systems, and processes quickly
  • Team player who’s open to ongoing feedback, learning, and development
Why Join Us:
  • Hands-on training and mentoring
  • Access to a robust internal knowledge base
  • Opportunities to collaborate with tech experts and leadership
  • A supportive team environment where growth is encouraged
If you're ready to jump into a dynamic support role where no two days are the same, apply now or reach out to learn more. We’re excited to meet you!

34219.title: Senior Technical NetSuite Architect
34219.publicDescription:
Senior Technical NetSuite Architect
Part-Time Contract | 20–30 Hours/Week | Remote (U.S.-based only)

Myticas Consulting is seeking a Senior Technical Architect with deep NetSuite ERP experience to support a long-term consulting engagement for a client in the advanced manufacturing space. This role will focus on architecting an ERP system for a network of pilot plants, helping lay the foundation for scalable and compliant manufacturing operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Gather and document business and technical requirements.

  • Guide ERP implementation partner selection.

  • Architect and oversee the design of a NetSuite ERP solution aligned with manufacturing needs.

  • Serve as a technical advisor throughout the implementation.

  • Collaborate with both internal teams and third-party vendors.

Qualifications:

  • 8+ years in ERP architecture, with hands-on NetSuite experience.

  • Strong understanding of manufacturing and supply chain workflows.

  • Experience working with implementation partners and cross-functional teams.

  • Excellent communication skills.

  • Must be located in the U.S.

Preferred:

  • Background in biotech, industrial manufacturing, or regulated industries.

  • Familiarity with compliance and data security best practices.

Apply today to connect with our team and learn more about this exciting opportunity.
